story:
Executive Summary:

There is a possibility for an exciting business/service that will work with colleges and universities across the United States. Boost Scooters, Incorporated will give students/faculty the option to rent a kick-scooter for personal short-distance transportation use.

For $0.15-0.25/min, it is possible for students, faculty members and staff to utilize a kick-scooter for daily use. Our scooter-sharing system has many positive advantages when compared with cars, and other modes of transportation on college campuses, which include: low operating and maintenance costs, low safety risk, and a decreased carbon footprint (environment friendly).

The target market for Boost will be colleges and universities across the country that are susceptible to on campus transportation. This includes 200+ campuses nationally. Within the university ecosystem, our target users are students, faculty and staff. In the future, our target market will expand to include select businesses/companies that have large campuses at which Boost can be useful. For both of these options, Boost scooters can be utilized to increase financially accessible campus transportation options and save travel time.

Many students do not have the disposable income that it takes to purchase personal transportation (kick/e-scooter, bike, etc.). Nor so they have the time or patience to carry it around/maintain it during the day. However, with the daily rental price of $0.15- $0.25, students are in a position to pay at least $30 throughout the semester for daily use of Boost scooters.

In year one, Boost Scooters would attempt to operate at least 10-15 scooters on multiple colleges and universities within the Philadelphia area. By year 2, Boost Scooters plans to transition our existing pilot programs into fully operational Boost campuses and expand to colleges and universities within the south and west regions of the country, targeting larger student populations.

Company Summary

Boost is an innovative scooter-sharing company that provides kick-scooters for student and faculty use on college and university campuses. Our mission is to provide colleges and universities with our service in hopes of combating student and university problems.

Students problems include but are not limited to:

  • Trouble finding convenient transportation options during the day
    • Trips across campus to eliminate tardiness/absence
    • For athletes, using scooters after a difficult workout/practice
  • Trouble finding convenient late-night transportation
    • For students who study across campus late at night and want to get to their dorm in a shorter amount of time
    • For students who do not feel safe walking across campus late at night
  • Trouble finding financially accessible modes of personal transportation
    • Bikes, scooters and other personal transportation options are expensive to buy
    • Not everyone can afford daily Uber, Lyft of taxi trips across campus

University problems include but are not limited to:

  • Sustainable commuting options
    • Safety
    • Environment friendly
  • Health/Wellness activities for students or faculty

Our Solutions

Boost Solutions include but are not limited to:

  1. Convenience: By utilizing Boost Scooters, students will be able to travel across campus in a fraction of the time. Multiple docks in strategic locations allow students to rent and return scooters at different locations with the click of a button.
  2. Financial Accessibility: Personal transportation is expensive and not everyone can afford a scooter or bike for hundreds of dollars. Boost scooter-sharing allows students to access viable personal transportation for less than $10 per semester.
  3. Wellness: Boost scooters can also be depicted as a way to increase wellness for college students. By equipping a student with a kick-scooter, he/she is more likely to alleviate time-related stress, while also burning a couple of calories.
  4. Campus Friendly: Boost kick-scooters are able to be used within the most popular walkways of any campus. Since they are not electric scooters, they pose a safer option to commute through campus minimizing the danger to bystanders.
  5. Sustainable Commuting: Boost scooters gives students the option to step away from Ubers, and other motorized vehicles. This ultimately decreases the Carbon footprint of any campus.

Our Keys to Success

  1. High quality customer service
  2. Maintaining active engagement with our customers:
    1. Seeking feedback
    2. Giving incentives
  3. Reaching our target market
    1. Seeking new partnerships with universities
  4. Integrity in serving our customers by providing value to colleges and universities

Our Product

This new design of the kick scooter poses many benefits for the rider as well as the bystander. The larger wheels allow for a more stable ride in many different environments. The non-slip foot pad benefits the rider in rainy and snowy weather. The braking system controls the front and rear wheels, and allows for easy control of the scooter speed.

How It Works

The company will most likely begin operating at a school in the form of a “pilot program”. With this program, we plan to install a modest number of Boost scooters and racks (10-15 scooters and 15-25 smart-racks) in strategic locations across the campus of a select university or college. Throughout the pilot we will be measuring important factors for later analysis with the purpose of refining our business model and service operations.  There will always be more racks than scooters, so students/faculty members can have the option of unlocking and locking a scooter at different locations. An example is pictured below:

Payments will be made through the Movatic App. Through this app, students/faculty members will register through our private system and upload their payment information. Customers can also see the availability & distance of each scooter within that campus area.

Risks & Challenges

Of course, there are some risks and challenges that come with this process.

The first challenge will be receiving the approval of institutions to implement this service on their campuses. While this will vary from school to school, many colleges and universities are beginning to implement services that provide scooters and/or bikes to students and are quite comfortable with the idea. With the dangers in liability that come with electric scooters, many universities shy away from such and are instead fans of kick-scooters. Therefore, we believe that this is a very opportune time for Boost to enter the market. 

Given that every school's financial budgeting will be very different, we must approach every negotiation with fresh eyes looking for the best deal for both sides. We a currently a growing team with room for advice. We are proud to be a part of an incubator with the Wharton School of Business and we believe that we have a substantial amount of resources and connections to help us through the process.

Lastly, we are prepared for the challenges that come with embarking on a startup. We are open to all advice, and we are dedicating a lot of time to respond to feedback and improve our company. By directly working with our manufacturer, we want to make it one of our primary focuses to be extremely responsive to problems, concerns, and feedback on the product and/or service. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate right at this moment, please do us a favor and just share our campaign. We need all the help we can get, and this could land in the hands of someone who could potentially help us out.

story:
Sorry you've missed our campaign. Brake Free is ready and can be purchased now! Please check out our new website for all the details.

Brake Free is an ultra bright smart LED brake light that instantly improves a motorcycle's visibility.

It mounts on the back of the helmet you already own and with its constant LED light at a driver's eye level, you'll be more visible both day and night.

Brake Free design, development, certification testing, and road testing is complete.

Production of our first mass production run is underway. 

"it makes you more visible to other motorists whether you're braking or not."
- Uncrate

 

 

 

"California startup Brake Free wants to make your helmet useful in preventing the emergency in the first place, but mounting a highly visible automatic LED brake light on it, where car drivers are more likely to notice and respond."
- Dan Carney, MAXIM

"The ultra bright smart LED brake light multiplies your visibility on the road, and the best thing? it has no wires, nothing to install on your bike, and works with no apps!"
- Bless This Stuff

"A bright red LED at their eye level that gets even brighter every time you slow down could make the difference between getting to your destination or winding up on in the hospital or worse."
- Bruce Brown, Digital Trends

 

Click HERE to view our press kit

 

 

Brake Free utilizes accelerometer and gyroscope sensors to autonomously detect when you're slowing down no matter how: braking, engine braking, or downshifting. When it does detect you braking, its LEDs glow brighter letting drivers around you know instantly. And there is no wired installation or connected apps with your phone for it to work.

 

 

Just mount it, turn it on, and ride.

 

 

Brake Free is able to detect 3 types of braking and respond accordingly:

  • Regular Braking: engaging front or rear brakes
  • Engine Braking: decelerating without touching your brake levers
  • Emergency Braking: triggers special light pattern

This is what makes Brake Free special: it's not just a passive LED light that is constantly on (and in this case, it's on the continuous flash mode--more on that below).

It responds to how you ride and alerts everyone around you when you're slowing down making you even more visible at this crucial point to prevent being rear ended.

Above, you'll see Brake Free's CEO Alex Arkhangelskiy riding with the unit on, looking left and right, and bobbing his head in which the unit's LED lights did not glow brighter. Only until he pulls up to a stop, the LEDs then glow brightly syncing with his tail brake light wirelessly thanks to the accelerometer and gyroscope sensors onboard.

We get asked a lot if the lights on Brake Free can be seen during the day time and the answer is a definite yes. The above is a raw clip from a GoPro mounted on the backpack of Brake Free's CEO Alex Arkhangelskiy slowing down during a day ride on the freeway.

In fact, the lights are typically so bright that the camera's sensors are usually saturated from the 100 red LEDs.

"After nearly 42 years of working in the motorcycle industry, and 17 specializing in helmets, one thing continues to prove true. A rider can NEVER be too visible. The Brake Free system is about as simple as it gets, yet offers a level of visibility unavailable prior to its introduction. It’s easy to install and will help riders to be seen when it counts the most. Brake Free is a simple, effective device that will dramatically improve the safety margin for all riders, regardless of skill level."

"Riding a motorcycle is like being invisible. To increase your odds of survival, it is crucial to increase your visibility. I use hi viz gear, headlight modulator and reflectors, and I will be adding Brake Free to ensure drivers see me."

"As the owner of a DIY motorcycle repair club I see so many bikes come in that have been clipped by cars that just did not see them or give them enough space for a turn. The novel idea of the Brake Free is a wonderful addition to increasing the visibility of all my riders - right at eye level for car drivers and without interfering with the riders reactions or responses. I'm recommending it to all the members!!"

Attaching Brake Free 

Brake Free attaches to almost any helmet with our unique universal clip mount

  • Quick and effortless transfer between helmets
  • Dovetail design for secure installation
  • Mount attaches to the helmet with 3M VHB adhesive
  • No damage to helmet surface

 

Mounts seen in the main pitch video are early prototypes and their look has changed from magnetic snap mounts to a mechanical clip mount.

Turning Brake Free On

Brake Free is easy to turn on even with gloves thanks to its one-touch button. When it does turn on, it flashes to indicate its battery level:

  • 3 flashes = 75-100% battery
  • 2 flashes = 30-60% battery
  • 1 flash = < 30% battery

 

Continuous Flash Mode

Brake Free also has a continuous flash mode which can be used as a hazard light. You can still wear it during this mode in which the light will function normally letting others know when you're slowing down by glowing brighter.

 

Turning Brake Free Off

And it's just as easy to turn off: Simple press and hold the one button for 3 seconds to turn off the unit.

 

Charging Brake Free

When it is time to charge Brake Free, simply use the included micro-USB cord to fully charge it in 2 hours.

Each BRAKE FREE unit comes with:

  • Micro USB charging cable
  • 1 helmet clip mount
  • User manual


 

We've gone through a series of prototypes prior to settling on the final Brake Free design. We got feedback from countless riders and industry insiders to help steer our design. We worked hard to keep the design slim, stylish and versatile. 

We've come a long way since our first proof of concept prototype. This prototype helped us validate our idea of being able to use sensors to detect deceleration. 

This was our test rig for tesing our algorithm with our sensor package collecting data from the helmet while riding. It involved lots of packaging tape, but it served its purpose. Don't try this at home.

Conducting measurements of the final design's LED brightness.

 

Our team has worked tirelessly for almost 3 years designing, developing, testing and iterating Brake Free. We connected with many industry professionals, motorcycle groups, influencers, and riders to make sure we are developing a product that is truly valuable and needed in our community.

We invested countless hours and close to $100,000 of our own money to get Brake Free to the stage it is at now. We iterated our design 4 times and we now have working prototypes that look and function like the finished product.

We cannot take this project any further without your help.

 

 

Alex Arkhangelskiy

Avid rider and founder of Brake Free. After receiving his bachelor's degree in Business and Entrepreneurship, he set out on a mission to develop products that satisfy his two passions: product development and motorcycling.

Ian Dunn

Professional Industrial Designer with 10 years in the powersports industry as a motorcycle designer, working for major OEMs across Europe and the US. Ian's been riding almost 20 years.

Johan Boot

An experienced and skilled engineer specializing in electro-mechanical system design, mechanical engineering, robotics and sensors. He has developed our custom sensor fusion algorithm which is the brains behind our platform.

Henry Li

The newest member of our team. Henry is a brilliant mechanical engineer with years of experience in designing cool products that have to work in very tough conditions. His experience in concept development, simulation, plastics design for both rapid prototyping and injection molding, testing, and proof of concept implementation is invaluable to our team and will undoubtedly help deliver Brake Free to all of our amazing backers. Did we mention he also loves to ride?!

Dave Hadden

Although his academic training was in Electronic Engineering, Dave is basically an inventor with a more natural affinity for mechanical engineering and a variety of manufacturing processes. In his 40+ entrepreneurial career he has 10 patents, 3 patents pending and over 100 products under his belt.



We are committed to delivering on our promises and bringing you a great product, and we won't settle for anything less.

We realize that some of you may have been burned in the past with a previous crowdfunding campaign that was highly successful that promised the ultimate motorcycle helmet...However, we are committed to rebuilding your trust and faith in motopreneurs with Brake Free.

We realize that taking a product from the prototype stage through manufacturing will present many challenges. We have done our best to anticipate and account for many of them in our timeline and budget. And while there may be some unforeseen complications throughout our journey, we promise to let you, our backers, know first and be transparent.

 

Click HERE to view our press kit

 

How much does it weigh?
Brake Free weighs 170 grams (6 ounces).
For easy comparison, it weighs a little less than an iPhone 7+.

How does it connect to my motorcycle?
It doesn't. We use sensors inside the unit along with our special algorithms that allow Brake Free to detect all types of braking; normal braking (applying front brake and/or rear brake) and engine braking.

Isn't this a huge safety issue?
The Brake Free unit attaches to the helmet using a universal clip mount. The clip mount uses a 3M VHB adhesive (much like GoPro mounts) to attach to the helmet. It is designed to break away from the helmet in case of an accident. It won't cause torsional damage to your head and neck. You are much safer with it than without it.

How long does the battery last?
Short answer, 8-10 hours on average. Long answer, it depends on the type of riding you're doing and the mode you select.

How long does it take to charge?
Brake Free takes 2 hours for a full charge.

Can I charge it on the go?
Yes. If you have a power bank or any other power source that can charge a device using USB cable, you can charge Brake Free while you ride.

Can I use it with multiple bikes?
Yes! Brake Free is completely wireless. It does not have any connection to your motorcycle. So use it on as many bikes as you want.

How do I know it fits my helmet?
The Brake Free unit is designed to fit all helmet shapes with horizontal or vertical feature lines. If the unit does not fit on your helmet let us know and we will come up with a custom mount solution.

What type of helmets will it fit on?
The Brake Free unit fits helmet sizes XS to XXL, matte or gloss finish, full face or half helmets. We have attached the prototype unit to road race helmets, street helmets, touring helmets, adventure helmets, modular helmets, and more.

How Do I install it on my helmet?
Brake Free requires a clear spot of about 6 inches by 3 inches on the back of your helmet.
First time installation:

  1. Take a second to plan where you'd like to mount brake free on the back of your helmet
  2. Clean the selected spot with an alcohol swab for better mount adhesion
  3. Attach the universal clip mount to Brake Free backplate (slips into female receptor slot on the back plate of Brake Free)
  4. Peal off the adhesive backing on the back of the universal clip mount
  5. Carefully align Brake Free to the selected spot (center it on the back of the helmet)
  6. Press Brake Free against the selected spot on the helmet for at least 30 seconds
  7. Done!

Will it fit if I have a Bluetooth module on my helmet?
Majority of Bluetooth headsets mount to the side of the helmet. Brake Free mounts to the back of the helmet. You should be able to add both products to your helmet without any issues.

How do I switch it from one helmet to another?
The easiest way is to order an extra helmet mount(s) and install one on each of the helmets you plan to you with Brake Free. Brake Free is designed for easy removal and installation. You can do this with one hand (without taking your gloves off)!

How can I tell how much battery charge is left?
When the unit powers on it will indicate the battery status. We are currently using the center LED panels to do that.
3 blinks = full battery, 2 blinks = 2/3 battery, 1 blink = 1/3 battery.

How can I tell it’s working?
When the unit powers up, it indicates the battery level. If the unit is in sleep mode, simply picking up the helmet will wake it up. You will see lights flashing as it wakes us. If picking it up or a quick shake did not wake it up, simply press the power button.

Will it make noise on my helmet?
No. The shape was designed to work harmoniously with the natural air flow around a helmet. You won't even notice it's there.

Can I ride with it in the rain?
We are aiming to get Brake Free IP64 certified, which means you can ride with it in the rain.

Can I clean it?
Yes. Use a dry or slightly damp cloth to clean the unit. We recommend using microfiber towels to prevent scratching the surface.

Is it legal?
In the United States there are no regulations preventing use of lights on helmets. Brake Free uses red LEDs that adhere to all DOT vehicle requirements.

How bright is it?
It is the brightest helmet accessory on the market by far. It is brighter than most motorcycle brake lights.

Can I swap batteries?
The Brake Free unit is sealed. At this time our design prevents user access to the battery.

Will my friends think I look awesome?
Yes! Totally.

Can I wear it while riding in a group?
Yes! As a matter of fact, it will improve your safety as a group. Riding in tight formation with other members' bike noise can make engine braking even harder to detect. The Brake Free unit will generally detect deceleration quicker than the naked eye and alert the riders behind, giving them an extra split second to react to you.

How is it different from other helmet mounted lights?
We are the only truly wireless helmet accessory. Brake Free is completely autonomous. It uses sensors and our algorithm to detect braking. Other units require a transmitter to be spliced into the wiring harness, causing potential electrical problems in the future. We also use lights that are thinner and brighter than anything out there.

What kind of light source does it use? E.g., LED?
We are using 4 custom shaped LED panels. There are 100 LEDs in total. These LEDs have a wide viewing angle of 120 degrees.

What color is the light?
The lens is red and so are the LEDs that are being used. These lights are so bright that they typically over-saturate the sensor on most cameras, making them look orange.


How bright is the light relative to other brake lights, both OEM and auxiliary (both incandescent and LED)?
Brake Free is brighter than most OEM brake lights. There are motorcycles coming out now with really bright brake lights, but they are still out of the line of sight of car drivers. The helmet lends itself as the perfect place to add more visibility.

If it uses an adhesive, does it damage the helmet (or leave a residue) when removed?
We are working with a 3M chemist to make sure we use an adhesive that will not damage your helmet when it is removed.

Can I claim multiple perks?
Yes, if you'd like to claim multiple perks, please make a new contribution for each perk.

Can I get a refund after the campaign has ended?
The money raised here on Indiegogo will go into product development, purchasing of materials, and manufacturing to deliver Brake Free to you. Refunds will only be issued if we can not deliver the final product after exploring all possible options. We will always be transparent and keep you updated on all developments.

Will the product vary from the design above?
While we have the preliminary design and prototypes built, we may still make some minor improvements. We love hearing from our supporters and if you have any suggestions we will be more than happy to consider it.

No damage to helmet surface
 Mounts seen in the main pitch video are early prototypes and their look has changed from magnetic snap mounts to a mechanical clip mount.Turning Brake Free OnBrake Free is easy to turn on even with gloves thanks to its one-touch button. When it does turn on, it flashes to indicate its battery level:
3 flashes = 75-100% battery
2 flashes = 30-60% battery
1 flash = < 30% battery
 Continuous Flash ModeBrake Free also has a continuous flash mode which can be used as a hazard light. You can still wear it during this mode in which the light will function normally letting others know when you're slowing down by glowing brighter. Turning Brake Free OffAnd it's just as easy to turn off: Simple press and hold the one button for 3 seconds to turn off the unit. Charging Brake FreeWhen it is time to charge Brake Free, simply use the included micro-USB cord to fully charge it in 2 hours.Each BRAKE FREE unit comes with:
Micro USB charging cable
1 helmet clip mount
User manual
 We've gone through a series of prototypes prior to settling on the final Brake Free design. We got feedback from countless riders and industry insiders to help steer our design. We worked hard to keep the design slim, stylish and versatile. We've come a long way since our first proof of concept prototype. This prototype helped us validate our idea of being able to use sensors to detect deceleration. This was our test rig for tesing our algorithm with our sensor package collecting data from the helmet while riding. It involved lots of packaging tape, but it served its purpose. Don't try this at home.Conducting measurements of the final design's LED brightness. Our team has worked tirelessly for almost 3 years designing, developing, testing and iterating Brake Free. We connected with many industry professionals, motorcycle groups, influencers, and riders to make sure we are developing a product that is truly valuable and needed in our community.We invested countless hours and close to $100,000 of our own money to get Brake Free to the stage it is at now. We iterated our design 4 times and we now have working prototypes that look and function like the finished product.We cannot take this project any further without your help.  Alex ArkhangelskiyAvid rider and founder of Brake Free. After receiving his bachelor's degree in Business and Entrepreneurship, he set out on a mission to develop products that satisfy his two passions: product development and motorcycling.Ian DunnProfessional Industrial Designer with 10 years in the powersports industry as a motorcycle designer, working for major OEMs across Europe and the US. Ian's been riding almost 20 years.Johan BootAn experienced and skilled engineer specializing in electro-mechanical system design, mechanical engineering, robotics and sensors. He has developed our custom sensor fusion algorithm which is the brains behind our platform.Henry LiThe newest member of our team. Henry is a brilliant mechanical engineer with years of experience in designing cool products that have to work in very tough conditions. His experience in concept development, simulation, plastics design for both rapid prototyping and injection molding, testing, and proof of concept implementation is invaluable to our team and will undoubtedly help deliver Brake Free to all of our amazing backers. Did we mention he also loves to ride?!Dave HaddenAlthough his academic training was in Electronic Engineering, Dave is basically an inventor with a more natural affinity for mechanical engineering and a variety of manufacturing processes. In his 40+ entrepreneurial career he has 10 patents, 3 patents pending and over 100 products under his belt.We are committed to delivering on our promises and bringing you a great product, and we won't settle for anything less.We realize that some of you may have been burned in the past with a previous crowdfunding campaign that was highly successful that promised the ultimate motorcycle helmet...However, we are committed to rebuilding your trust and faith in motopreneurs with Brake Free.We realize that taking a product from the prototype stage through manufacturing will present many challenges. We have done our best to anticipate and account for many of them in our timeline and budget. And while there may be some unforeseen complications throughout our journey, we promise to let you, our backers, know first and be transparent. Click HERE to view our press kit How much does it weigh?Brake Free weighs 170 grams (6 ounces).For easy comparison, it weighs a little less than an iPhone 7+.How does it connect to my motorcycle?It doesn't. We use sensors inside the unit along with our special algorithms that allow Brake Free to detect all types of braking; normal braking (applying front brake and/or rear brake) and engine braking.Isn't this a huge safety issue?The Brake Free unit attaches to the helmet using a universal clip mount. The clip mount uses a 3M VHB adhesive (much like GoPro mounts) to attach to the helmet. It is designed to break away from the helmet in case of an accident. It won't cause torsional damage to your head and neck. You are much safer with it than without it.How long does the battery last?Short answer, 8-10 hours on average. Long answer, it depends on the type of riding you're doing and the mode you select.How long does it take to charge?Brake Free takes 2 hours for a full charge.Can I charge it on the go?Yes. If you have a power bank or any other power source that can charge a device using USB cable, you can charge Brake Free while you ride.Can I use it with multiple bikes?Yes! Brake Free is completely wireless. It does not have any connection to your motorcycle. So use it on as many bikes as you want.How do I know it fits my helmet?The Brake Free unit is designed to fit all helmet shapes with horizontal or vertical feature lines. If the unit does not fit on your helmet let us know and we will come up with a custom mount solution.What type of helmets will it fit on?The Brake Free unit fits helmet sizes XS to XXL, matte or gloss finish, full face or half helmets. We have attached the prototype unit to road race helmets, street helmets, touring helmets, adventure helmets, modular helmets, and more.How Do I install it on my helmet?Brake Free requires a clear spot of about 6 inches by 3 inches on the back of your helmet.First time installation:
Take a second to plan where you'd like to mount brake free on the back of your helmet
Clean the selected spot with an alcohol swab for better mount adhesion
Attach the universal clip mount to Brake Free backplate (slips into female receptor slot on the back plate of Brake Free)
Peal off the adhesive backing on the back of the universal clip mount
Carefully align Brake Free to the selected spot (center it on the back of the helmet)
Press Brake Free against the selected spot on the helmet for at least 30 seconds
Done!
Will it fit if I have a Bluetooth module on my helmet?Majority of Bluetooth headsets mount to the side of the helmet. Brake Free mounts to the back of the helmet. You should be able to add both products to your helmet without any issues.How do I switch it from one helmet to another?The easiest way is to order an extra helmet mount(s) and install one on each of the helmets you plan to you with Brake Free. Brake Free is designed for easy removal and installation. You can do this with one hand (without taking your gloves off)!How can I tell how much battery charge is left?When the unit powers on it will indicate the battery status. We are currently using the center LED panels to do that.3 blinks = full battery, 2 blinks = 2/3 battery, 1 blink = 1/3 battery.How can I tell it’s working?When the unit powers up, it indicates the battery level. If the unit is in sleep mode, simply picking up the helmet will wake it up. You will see lights flashing as it wakes us. If picking it up or a quick shake did not wake it up, simply press the power button.Will it make noise on my helmet?No. The shape was designed to work harmoniously with the natural air flow around a helmet. You won't even notice it's there.Can I ride with it in the rain?We are aiming to get Brake Free IP64 certified, which means you can ride with it in the rain.Can I clean it?Yes. Use a dry or slightly damp cloth to clean the unit. We recommend using microfiber towels to prevent scratching the surface.Is it legal?In the United States there are no regulations preventing use of lights on helmets. Brake Free uses red LEDs that adhere to all DOT vehicle requirements.How bright is it?It is the brightest helmet accessory on the market by far. It is brighter than most motorcycle brake lights.Can I swap batteries?The Brake Free unit is sealed. At this time our design prevents user access to the battery.Will my friends think I look awesome?Yes! Totally.Can I wear it while riding in a group?Yes! As a matter of fact, it will improve your safety as a group. Riding in tight formation with other members' bike noise can make engine braking even harder to detect. The Brake Free unit will generally detect deceleration quicker than the naked eye and alert the riders behind, giving them an extra split second to react to you.How is it different from other helmet mounted lights?We are the only truly wireless helmet accessory. Brake Free is completely autonomous. It uses sensors and our algorithm to detect braking. Other units require a transmitter to be spliced into the wiring harness, causing potential electrical problems in the future. We also use lights that are thinner and brighter than anything out there.What kind of light source does it use? E.g., LED? We are using 4 custom shaped LED panels. There are 100 LEDs in total. These LEDs have a wide viewing angle of 120 degrees.What color is the light?The lens is red and so are the LEDs that are being used. These lights are so bright that they typically over-saturate the sensor on most cameras, making them look orange.How bright is the light relative to other brake lights, both OEM and auxiliary (both incandescent and LED)?Brake Free is brighter than most OEM brake lights. There are motorcycles coming out now with really bright brake lights, but they are still out of the line of sight of car drivers. The helmet lends itself as the perfect place to add more visibility.If it uses an adhesive, does it damage the helmet (or leave a residue) when removed?We are working with a 3M chemist to make sure we use an adhesive that will not damage your helmet when it is removed.Can I claim multiple perks?Yes, if you'd like to claim multiple perks, please make a new contribution for each perk.Can I get a refund after the campaign has ended?The money raised here on Indiegogo will go into product development, purchasing of materials, and manufacturing to deliver Brake Free to you. Refunds will only be issued if we can not deliver the final product after exploring all possible options. We will always be transparent and keep you updated on all developments.Will the product vary from the design above? While we have the preliminary design and prototypes built, we may still make some minor improvements. We love hearing from our supporters and if you have any suggestions we will be more than happy to consider it.

story:
We prefer Fatties! And you will too.

Our Fat Tire Bikes offer a comfortable and exciting ride on Sand, Snow, Mountain, Street and More. There is no better way to travel the scenic beach coasts, off-road trails or even snow than on a Fat Tire Bike. 

Plus, our bikes have all-sealed bearings and stainless steel bolts for superior, long lasting ability in salt and weather.

We are Overstocked with Fatties.

Help us clean out our warehouse which is overstocked with these beautiful Fatties to make room for new ones coming soon. We are offering our Fat Bikes at an incredibly low price starting at $399 for a 3-Speed Beach Bike Cruiser and $499 for a 8-Speed Fat All Terrain Bike.

We have 200 bikes ready to be shipped immediately upon the campaign end. So if you contribute today, you could be enjoying your Fatty by Labor Day! 

3-Speed Beach Bike Cruiser  


The 3-Speed Beach Bike Cruiser adds multiple gears to make riding easier. Packed with all the wide tire fun and flexibility of every other Fatties Bike. Take this ride anywhere you would take a fat beach bike and turn some heads today.


SPECIFICATIONS:

Frame: All Aluminum Construction Includes Water Bottle Bosses, Cable Guides for Continuous Housing, Horizontal Rear Dropouts, Integral Rear Disc Brake Caliper Mount; 15", 17" and 20" Sizes Available

Fork: All Aluminum Construction, 1-1/8" Threadless, Includes Dual Cable Guides and Integral Dual Front Disc Brake Caliper Mounts

Headset: All Weather Alloy with SS Sealed Bearings

Wheels: 26” x 4” Fat Sand Bike Rims with Black Anodized Finish and Chrome Spokes

Hubs: Rear – Steel 3 Speed/CB Hub Front – Alloy Disc Compatible Hub

Brakes: Coaster (Foot) Brake

Gears: Shimano Nexus Three Speed (Internal)

Shifter: Twist Shifter

Tires: 26” x 4.8” XXXL (30 PSI) - the largest and fattest tire in the market

Tubes: 26” x 4” (Schrader Valve)

Crankset: Aluminum Alloy Black 3-Piece

Chainring: Aluminum Alloy Black 39T

Bottom Bracket: Extra Wide 122mm All Weather Sealed Bearing

Chain: KMC Rustbuster

Pedals: Weather Resistant Composite Platform with Reflectors

Seat: Cloud-9 Gel Padded, Dual Elastomer Spring

Seat Post: Alloy Black with QR Clamp

Handlebar: Black Alloy Oversize ATB

Grips: Anatomically Contoured Krayton Rubber

Stem: Threadless Style Black Anodized Aluminum Alloy 130°, 90mm, SS Bolts

Other: CPSC Reflectors, Kickstand

Weight: 38 lbs.

8-Speed All Terrain Fat Tire Bikes


The 8-speed All Terrain Fat Tire Bike has been engineered to last with rust resistant aluminum and stainless steel components throughout and contains features normally reserved for significantly more expensive bicycles in its class. 

SPECIFICATIONS:


Frame: All Aluminum Construction Includes Water Bottle Bosses, Cable Guides for Continuous Housing, Horizontal Rear Dropouts, Integral Rear Disc Brake Caliper Mount; 15", 17" and 20" Sizes Available

Fork: All Aluminum Construction, 1-1/8" Threadless, Includes Dual Cable Guides and Integral Dual Front Disc Brake Caliper Mounts 

Headset: All Weather Alloy with SS Sealed Bearings

Wheels: 26” x 4” Fat Sand Bike Rims with Black Anodized Finish and Chrome Spokes

Hubs: Rear – Alloy Nexus 8 Speed Front – Alloy Disc Compatible Hub

Brakes: Rear Roller Brake

Gears: Shimano Nexus 8 Speed Internal

Shifter: Twist Shifter

Tires: 26” x 4.8” XXXL (30 PSI) - the largest and fattest tire in the market

Tubes: 26” x 4” (Schrader Valve, 20 PSI)

Crankset: Aluminum Alloy Black 3-Piece

Chainring: Aluminum Alloy Black 39T

Bottom Bracket: Extra Wide 122mm All Weather Sealed Bearing

Chain: KMC Rustbuster

Pedals: Weather Resistant Composite Platform with Reflectors

Seat: Cloud-9 Gel Padded, Dual Elastomer Spring

Seat Post: Alloy Black with QR Clamp

Handlebar: Black Alloy Oversize ATB

Grips: Anatomically Contoured Krayton Rubber

Stem: Threadless Style Black Anodized Aluminum Alloy 130°, 90mm, SS Bolts

Other: CPSC Reflectors, Kickstand

Weight: 38 lbs.

story:
Flies land on things you never want to set foot in, though you probably have, then they land on your sandwich! Yuck!  That's why we invented the Garbage Can Fly Trap.  It doesn’t require chemical attractants, the use of unsightly fly strips or chasing flies with a swatter! Join us as we unite to say no more to the dreaded fly on our sandwiches, kitchen counters and anywhere else that matters!

We've successfully funded our first Kickstarter.com campaign raising close to $13,000  from nearly 300 backers, from more than 20 countries world-wide.  We're excited to bring our product to Indiegogo.com to continue to take pre-orders while we build our manufacturing infrastructure. 


AS SEEN ON:



PERKS

SAN DIEGO VIP SPECIAL*
Valid along the I-5 corridor: Oceanside to Imperial Beach, the SR-78 corridor: Oceanside to Escondido, the I-8 corridor: Ocean Beach to El Cajon, the I-15 corridor: Temecula to San Diego and everywhere in between.

Hole Saw Special**
This exact hole saw can be purchased at Home Depot for $12.57 (1-1/2 in. Hole Dozer Hole Saw with Arbor).  Garbage Can Fly Trap takes no responsibility for damage to persons, garbage receptacles or any other property due to the use of a hole saw.

 The Trap & Cartridge

The Garbage Can Fly Trap allows users to discretely catch and eliminate flies from kitchens, homes and outdoor areas. Flies, already attracted to food waste in your garbage, walk into the trap (installed in the lid of your garbage can) and are caught in the disposable paper cartridge (under the garbage can lid). The disposable cartridge is lined with fly paper which prevents the fly's escape. The trap doesn’t require chemical attractants, the use of unsightly fly paper strips, or chasing flies with a swatter. The disposable cartridge can then be released directly into your garbage bag via a quick release button on top of the trap allowing for hands-free disposal. The Garbage Can Fly Trap captures fruit flies too!  Patent Pending

How It Works

Flies are naturally attracted to the smell of garbage in your garbage can. Flies, being attracted to the scent, seek the easiest route to gain access. We have designed the Garbage Can Fly Trap to let them think they have found it.  They enter on the exterior of the trap under the quick release button and follow their "nose" to the disposable cartridge below.  The cartridge contains fly paper which prevents their escape.  When you are ready to throw away the trap, simply push the quick release button to release the disposable cartridge directly in to the trash.  Then snap on a new cartridge and you are ready to go!

WARNING - Flies Were Harmed In The Making of This Gadget

PROTOTYPING

Early Prototype: Caught flies but they were loud when lid was opened

Next Prototype: 

Flypaper = quiet flies but cage removal required touching it.

Video = approx. 15 minutes (edited for brevity) of fly capturing badness!

Easy Installation In Less Than A Minute

Garbage can lids are the best location to mount the Garbage Can Fly Trap (no bait is necessary - just your garbage) but there are many other containers to which the trap can be mounted (but you will need to bait them - we have found food scraps work best for house flies and rotting fruit works best for fruit flies).

If you know what a drill is used for, you can install the Garbage Can Fly Trap. Simply drill a 1.5" hole in the lid of your collection device of choice and attach the Garbage Can Fly Trap.  Then snap on a cartridge and you are all set.

 Results After 1 Afternoon In Curbside Garbage Can - there are 68!


 
 PLAY  

Subtitles & Captions

Easy Installation In Less Than A Minute
Garbage can lids are the best location to mount the Garbage Can Fly Trap (no bait is necessary - just your garbage) but there are many other containers to which the trap can be mounted (but you will need to bait them - we have found food scraps work best for house flies and rotting fruit works best for fruit flies).

 Fruit Fly Abatement
If you know what a drill is used for, you can install the Garbage Can Fly Trap. Simply drill a 1.5" hole in the lid of your collection device of choice and attach the Garbage Can Fly Trap.  Then snap on a cartridge and you are all set.

 Quick and Easy Installation!

story:
We will not be carried by a flashy ad campaign. The animation and artistic images are for conceptual use only. However, we do have:

A Concept, a Prototype, a Plan and a Team. We are ready if you are. 

The Basic Concept 

Do you prefer to "do it yourself"? Many people do. What If I told you that you could build your own electric car? Other than a few mechanics, most would call me "nuts". Yet, I will say it again "You do not need to be a mechanic to build a car" and this is true. Every day our children are already doing so, though with vehicles of a smaller scale. The facts are simple. Most radio controlled (RC) cars and trucks, powered by battery packs and electric motors, are more complex than the average EV. It is true. An EV utilizes no technologies which cannot be found in an RC. The main issue is that nobody has yet taken the steps to put it all into one package. Our kits will do just this while also offering "plug and play" simplicity. We will also include a step by step video, so if you get stuck, we are there with you. Companies like Speedway Motors almost do it, by offering Vintage Hot Rod Replica Kits. However, being offered only with combustion engine options, the skills and knowledge of a mechanic, are once again a major factor. Our EV kits will "break the mold" and empower you to truly do it yourself. Screw drivers, wrenches and a voltmeter are the only tools you will need.

Estimated retail pricing as low as $20K for entry level kits (complete) which can always be upgraded later, and race ready beginning as low as $40K.


Components of an EV Replica Kit: 
First you will be able to choose from our list of options. A personalized kit will be packaged by us. It will include all of the parts needed to build a complete electric car. Step by step written instructions, a real time build video, an optional tool kit and on call tech support, will ensure that you can do it yourself. And if not, or if you are just to busy for the 40 hour estimated build time, you can create a new job. We can arrange a list of "junior builders" in your area, who are quailified and ready to build (or help). Below is a "brief" summary of options we plan to offer. It is written in depth for those who "need" to know, while the componants and key points are in bold type for those who like it simple. If we have left anything out which you wish to know, ask and we will answer. No secrets kept and any parts we build will not be patented.  


The Shell (our first goal will make the molds)

Choose a fiber glass shell (to fit your budget) or go with our race ready carbon fiber shell. Each will be reinforced with kevler at the stress points with integrated framing and predrilled mounting plates. Exterior and interior trim options will be available (as well as trimless for the minimalist builders). Being that each shell will be made to order, custom alterations will also be available upon request. Windshields to be delivered pre-installed while window pre-installation is optional. Custom convertible options also available. Our "mold master" Antonio, with his professional fabrication skills and experience, will ensure the quality of our shells. His  most recent collaboration with Ford and Addictive Dessert Designs, was seen at the 2014 SEMA show. (Carbon Z600 shown below for reference only, not ours)    

Also, if the first generation is a success (Gen 1), a micro truck replica body will follow. The Gen 2 shell will be fully interchangable with Gen 1 kits, with a matching wheelbase and bolt pattern. An original design (our own and not a replica) will be introduced if and when a 3rd generation is reached. 


The Chassis 

The chassis' are to be built from gusseted steel tube framing for strength (shown without gussets, mid build). Easy to access, nuts and bolts will enable quick intsallation and removal. Choose from separated front and rear subframes, or the rolling chassis option which utilizes a one piece frame. Alterations will be avilable upon request. For Gen 2 we plan to release our lifted crawler frame. This frame will fit our Gen 2 body as well as the Gen 1 . 


Suspension 

Suspension options will allow you to select your desired ride height. Fixed or adjustable options will be available. Independant rear suspension and budget friendly leaf spring options will be available. 

The Motor            

Motors are to be offered in many sizes. Choose from AC or DC drive, ranging in power from 60-200HP 


Transmission options will include a 5 speed manual (w/clutch) or a 3 speed automatic (with optimized shift points to match your specific system and driving style).  


The Axles

To handle the extra torque which can be produced by an electric motor, all kits will include custom built axles (400HP rated from DriveShaftShop.com). However, don't be scared, as the motor's torque limit is adjustable for safety. If you want it "unleashed", it will be there waiting for you. RWD (rear wheel drive) and AWD (all wheel drive) models will be available. AWD kits will also include a custom driveshaft.


Steering will be offered in US Standard (left hand steering) as well as JDM or EURO style (right hand steering). 

The Speed Controller

Speed controller options will determine your overall performance limits. All speed controllers are adjustable (amp and ramp) so you can either feel the power or get the range (or anywhere between). Up to 200HP (1000A controllers only) or up to 200mile per charge with any controller when paired with our largest battery pack. The base model DC speed controller shown above. 


The Battery Pack   

Battery packs are to be offered in several sizes, which will determine your range between charges. All packs offered will utilize Lithium Iron Phosphate technology (LifePO4), chosen for safety, enviromental impact and performance. One of our single cells is pictured above, yet we do have options from several different manufacturers. As of now, our battery prices cannot be beat. 

The Main Power Cables

Cables and lugs will all be 4/0 guage. With reduced resistance comes more power and less heat. Available either pre-wired or you can cut and crimp your own. 

12V Wiring and Fuse box are to be prewired and color coded for an easy install (all fuses also included). DC/DC converter also included (provides 12V output from the high voltage battery pack) and a dedicated 12V battery is optional. 

The Battery Charger 

                  

Battery chargers are to be offered in both onboard and outboard models. Most onboard chargers will give a full charge in 3 hours or less, and are built into the car. While outboard chargers can reduce charge time to less than an hour, they are kept outside the car (like a gas pump). Many plug option are available, charge at home, at work or at a charging station.


Battery Management System (BMS) & Touchscreen Display

A BMS will be included with every kit. This is the computer which controls and monitors the charging and discharging of your battery pack to avoid damage and to ensure longevity. It also enables driver to monitor real time power consumption and fuel capacity. This enables you to adjust your driving style to attain an increased range per charge. The touchscreen display enables coded access for advanced programming of all parameters. 

LED lighting (headlights too) will be offered. Not only to keep up with technology but also to conserve power.   
Wheels and Tires will be offered in multiple styles with 3 sizes to choose from. 

Seats and interior 

While specifics are yet to be determined. We will include optional Woodgrain, Carbon Fiber or Aluminum inserts. Leather seats, dash and doorskins will also be available.
Available Upgrades will evolve and so will your car. All 2nd Generation parts will fit 1st generation kits. So you won't get stuck in the "old" as we move forward. 
Custom Decals 

Decals and wraps will be available to let your new fans know who's car it is, or  to endorse your business. Select from our graphics or create your own. Racing stripes, two-tone wraps and #s also available. All body wraps will be done with 3M Envision wrap products. The worlds first Non-PVC wraps. They are more versatile, durable and eco friendly than any alternatives available. 

Individual Parts will also be available for order. So if you only need our replica shell for your Suzuki Samarai frame, we got you covered. We will build it to bolt right on!

               

Comments and input are and always will be encouraged (questions too). Your ideas will help our product evolve. 

 

The Birth and Growth of a Concept: The story of an Obsession.... 

Inititially it was a personal mission. Several years ago while still waiting for the "big guys" to present a decent EV, I decided to take it into my own hands. With help, I was going to build my own. Yet if we were going to build it, I needed  Something worth keeping. I began searching. It was not long before I got a call from long time friend. "I found your car" he told me with confidence. Trusting his taste and judgement, I drove over to his shop right away (proved to be well worth the 200 miles round trip).
I could not have been more pleased. My friend Forest, had found "the" car. 
 

       

I had never seen one before, but I was in love. A Japanese, 1972 Honda Niii 360. It was RHD and never released in the US. A perfect candidate for an electric transplant. Though I felt bad about gutting a rare vintage import, it had to be done. 
As we moved forward on the project, the world of blogs began to confirm that our dream was also shared by others. Within days after posting the project on a friend's website, "the public" found it and began to respond. From blog to blog, attention and comments began coming in all directions. Our project was turning heads, (though  mistaken for a 1969 because of it's rarity). Our project was referenced on websites such as Jalopnik, Ridelust, Auto Green Magazine and Clunkbucket. Ridelust's Dustin Driver, chose to run it again in his Top 10 favorites for 2010. From the articles (see links above), a few quotes really stood out. This inspired us to go further: 


"If the rear-wheel drive, electric Honda N360 isn't the anti-fail, we do not know what is" - Sam Smith 


CLUNKBUCKET"Some folks actually go so far as to get the pieces. Far fewer fabricate the pieces into something that works" - Mike Bumbeck 

 


   "Not even the fantastic fever dreams of a madman could conjure this....truly an amazing piece of work....One of my all time favorites"  -Dustin Driver


   "Back in October at the Tokyo Motor Show, Honda unveiled an electric vehicle concept....inspired by the tiny N360....While the EV-N may or may not provide a upcoming car....a little custome car shop in Santa Rosa, CA has been working on the real thing"  -


Just as the comments and discussions began, we watched Jalopnik's column climb past 10,000 views. With input, our inspirations grew. Your dreams soon became the goal. If for myself, why not for others? Yet with expectation, comes responsibility. After shifting our focus, the project soon went underground. While kept hidden from the public, it was not to be referenced again... Until now. After 4 years of silence, this is what we have done: 

Initial Process is Complete: Building a Prototype
We began with a whole car. A Japanese, RHD Honda Niii 360. Similar to the N600, which was available in the US, yet with a smaller engine. Originally, it weighed in at 1180lbs and was powered by a 34hp motorcycle engine. This is a brief summary.

We removed everything which would no longer be needed. (Cody handled the rear with a smile)

 Custom wheel wells were built from sheet steel (to fit the new wheels).

Wheel wells and structural reinforcement were installed in the rear.

We selected a prime location for the electric motor and race prepped tranny.  

With the front wheel wells installed, the custom strut towers were built.

Our custom front subframe (and no engine), would provide an ideal location and have enough support for main battery pack. 

The rear strut towers and motor mounts were then designed, built and installed. 

Then came the rear subframe... 

 ...with custom rear control arms and modified spindles. 

The motor, transmission and adjustable rear suspension were installed,

as well as adjustable front suspension. 

Everything was coming together as if meant to be. 
 
Once again the car was holding it's own weight. It was "Re-framed" and ready.

After the custom steering and brakes were complete, and some neccesary body work to repair some "40 years of funk". 

A new life approached...

Now that it could finally roll, steer and stop, we moved onto the final stages of the build. Day by day the "to do" list got shorter. From the electronics to the custom axles, it all came together perfectly. 

The prototype was complete and ready for road testing in August 2014.

Where are we now?

I have mine, and I love it. It can be plugged in anywhere, and can drive up to 150 miles per charge with it's current battery pack. When I do not need the range, I can turn up the power and tighten my belt. Green, clean, quiet and quick. 

Now let's make one for you. We are more than half way there. Though it has taken years to come to fruition, the prototype has finally hit the road. After several months of road testing we have decided take the next step. However, we cannot go any further on our own. We have the team and all of the resources to begin the replication process (other than the funding). With your help it will happen.

If Initial Goal of $50K is Reached:

We will be able to fund the casting process for the body. This will enable future production of the body shells, as well as at least one carbon fiber copy. This will be marketed alone (as just a shell) and will be cast to fit previously exsisting frames (Classic Mini and Susuki Samarai) with minimal alteration (we can do this by hand for now). Potentially being a way to fund the steps towards total reproduction (made to order). A solid first step.


Stretches:

$100K: The ability to reproduce, yet the sale of the first car produced would be necessary to cover the funding for the next step. Still progress.
$120K: Rather than selling the first one, we will begin a marketing and education tour ( schools, hobby and car shows). We will be ready for orders. The marketing team and advertising can wait (and will need to). 
Above $120K: It will take some penny pinching, yet we will be able to make it work.  Though we will have no room for paid ad campaigns or a fancy website, the kits will be available. We will just need to promote them by ourselve (and you). Still a wonderful thing.


Full-Stretch: if our "full stretch" goal of $150K goal is reached

1.  All perks will be produced and/or shipped. 

2. The body molds will be built. This will enable shells to be produced to order.
3. All current custom metal parts will be transferred to STL files (digital plans) to enable CNC reproduction (computer controlled cutting, bending and welding). This will greatly reduce production time and labor required, which will greatly reduce the final cost to the consumer. Other interior panels will be transferred as well, to enable production in wood, metal or composite materials.
4. At least one full carbon fiber electric kit car will be completed, titled and registered. It will be a "performance model" ready for the marketing tour. 
5. We will aquire a marketing and media team. A catalogue and website will be created. 
6. We will be ready and able to produce our first kits upon demand. One order at a time, yet production none the less. Demand will determine and/or fund further expansion of our production abilities. The sky is the limit.

*7. Offered to prior contributors only. Limited pre-orders will begin within 14 days after our 150K goal is surpassed (to ensure production). Pre-orders will be taken on a first come first serve basis. Summer 2015 delivery to be available for the first 3 orders (those placed befor April).  Estimated kit prices are as follows: 

Base Model Kits: beginning as low as $20K, 
Performance Model Kits: beginning at $30K
Track Ready Kits: beginning a $40K (wheely bars included, no joke!). 


Partial Funding: if our goal is not reached

$1 or more: No matter what we will honor the promised perks. Even if out of pocket. 
Less than $50,000: We will need to move on to aquiring investors to reach our projected budget. Not ideal, yet still a step closer to beginning the replication process. Enough for us to push on, and continue trying. 

Support without funding: The Power of Words

Thank you for reading, that itself is a large contribution. Your attention is priceless. For those who wish to show support in a way other than funding. It is as simple as talking. If you like it, tell people about it. Share the link. The power is the word. 


Until then, we will continue "dreaming"...

We will not be carried by a flashy ad campaign. The animation and artistic images are for conceptual use only. However, we do have:
A Concept, a Prototype, a Plan and a Team. We are ready if you are. 


The Basic Concept 


Do you prefer to "do it yourself"? Many people do. What If I told you that you could build your own electric car? Other than a few mechanics, most would call me "nuts". Yet, I will say it again "You do not need to be a mechanic to build a car" and this is true. Every day our children are already doing so, though with vehicles of a smaller scale. The facts are simple. Most radio controlled (RC) cars and trucks, powered by battery packs and electric motors, are more complex than the average EV. It is true. An EV utilizes no technologies which cannot be found in an RC. The main issue is that nobody has yet taken the steps to put it all into one package. Our kits will do just this while also offering "plug and play" simplicity. We will also include a step by step video, so if you get stuck, we are there with you. Companies like Speedway Motors almost do it, by offering Vintage Hot Rod Replica Kits. However, being offered only with combustion engine options, the skills and knowledge of a mechanic, are once again a major factor. Our EV kits will "break the mold" and empower you to truly do it yourself. Screw drivers, wrenches and a voltmeter are the only tools you will need. Estimated retail pricing as low as $20K for entry level kits (complete) which can always be upgraded later, and race ready beginning as low as $40K. 



Components of an EV Replica Kit: 

First you will be able to choose from our list of options. A personalized kit will be packaged by us. It will include all of the parts needed to build a complete electric car. Step by step written instructions, a real time build video, an optional tool kit and on call tech support, will ensure that you can do it yourself. And if not, or if you are just to busy for the 40 hour estimated build time, you can create a new job. We can arrange a list of "junior builders" in your area, who are quailified and ready to build (or help). Below is a "brief" summary of options we plan to offer. It is written in depth for those who "need" to know, while the componants and key points are in bold type for those who like it simple. If we have left anything out which you wish to know, ask and we will answer. No secrets kept and any parts we build will not be patented.

story:
THE BREAKDOWN TRIANGLE - AN OUTDATED CONCEPT

IWARN® - YOUR SECOND LIFE IN THE BOOT

WARNING - RESCUING - GETTING HELP

 

 

Modern vehicles with their active and passive safety systems have advanced significantly over the years but even when you are having an accident with a premium car the safety system you are using to secure the accident scene is more than 50 years old, viz. a breakdown triangle. When you are counting on your hazard flasher you may be left abandoned sometimes. Depending on the impact, this device simply will no longer work as the blinkers are destroyed mechanically in most cases. Moreover, more than 70% of crashed vehicles come to a standstill crosswise to the direction of traffic so even a working hazard flasher will almost not be visible to other vehicles.

In addition, experience has shown that especially on motorways breakdown triangles are run over by other road users in no time and as they are set up on the ground they are poorly visible only. Terrible accident reports of the last few years show that serious sequential accidents happen time and again costing the lives of innocent bystanders who had not been hurt in the accident in the first place. This is because following road users did not recognise clearly an accident scene.

Especially on motorways minutes may decide between life and death.

 

 

Our objective was to invent a novel, easy-to-use warning light for everybody incorporating state-of-the-art technology. “Warning light 4.0” so to speak. In fact, IWARN® is not only the world’s strongest and most advanced mobile warning light but a complete rescue system, as well for we integrated also state-of-the-art GPS and GSM. Owing to the use of 21 heavy-duty LEDs together with special ancillary lenses IWARN® is visible for kilometres. Depending on the situation, the user can choose among different flashes (emergency signal for mountainous regions, SOS, flashing, etc.) and continuous light. Moreover, its unique cruciform structure (similar to a railroad crossing sign) allows creating directional arrows (flashing to the left/right) in order to reroute traffic this way. 

Apart from reliable optical warning for the prevention of sequential accidents it is essential to get help as fast as possible. Shocked victims of an accident frequently are not able to give an exact description to rescuers where to find them. In such cases, IWARN® is a reliable tool. At one push of a button the operator will release a complete chain of rescue measures.

Every IWARN® has a built-in highly sensitive GPS receiver with a positional accuracy of approx. 1.5 meters. This GPS module is complemented by an extra strong GSM module which is appropriate for all national and international networks and which registers always in the network having the best reception at the moment. So, the risk to be in an area with no reception and to be unable to make a call is almost excluded for persons seeking help. The user can choose from 2 different emergency calls:  

Emergency call for roadside assistance: such a call is made to report a breakdown (no accident, no injured persons) to the IWARN® alarm centre, e.g. when a car is standing on a breakdown lane on a motorway. This call will be forwarded to the headquarters of motorway operators for their information, for example. 

Emergency call after an accident: this call allows signalling an accident. The IWARN® alarm centre forwards the call to the responsible rescue organisation and will send help immediately. IWARN® will establish connections automatically to avoid that persons involved in an accident may not remember the right number in their state of shock.

 
 
 

"Cars keep getting safer and safer. And yet, accidents occur. 

Even if an accident is a close shave sometimes, you may soon be exposed to a potential life-threatening situation immediately afterwards on account of possible sequential accidents especially on dual carriageways and motorways. In this dangerously narrow time window it is vital that the accident situation is well recognizable and can be spotted fast. 

 For many years, I have been volunteering as ambulance man and time and again I noticed that a more than 50-year old safety system, viz. a breakdown triangle, meets these requirements only poorly and that this system is no longer up to date. So, it was my objective to invent a modern and novel rescue instrument and to set new standards by creating state-of-the-art technology. 

Today, after thousands of hours of work and designing more than 40 prototypes this goal has been accomplished. IWARN® is the most advanced warning light in the world and was developed to protect not only you and your loved ones but also following road users in the critical seconds and minutes after an accident and to ensure fast aid."

  Thomas K. Stelzl, IWARN® Inventor

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

To enable various applications, IWARN® comes with an integrated adapter ball allowing quick and safe connection to different holder systems for use at work or during your leisure time. The ultramodern magnetic base for the installation of IWARN® on the car top is standard equipment. It allows mounting it safely even in wet conditions or when it is snowing. It can withstand speeds of more than 150 km/h and comes with a scratch-preventing surface for the protection of your car paint.

Place your IWARN® on the car top using the magnetic base and align it. If the vehicle is badly damaged, you can mount IWARN® on the vehicle also in any other position provided that it faces the oncoming traffic. IWARN® even clings in wet conditions and with snow and does not  scratch the car paint.  

 

Owing to its state-of-the-art integrated computer control, operation requires only a minimum of 3 buttons: 

ON/OFF BUTTON – to turn on and off the entire system / when turning it on, “Flash Mode” (maximum luminance) will be activated automatically for protection 

FUNCTION BUTTON – to control the various blinking signals 

CALL BUTTON – to make emergency calls using the installed GSM module .

 

 
 

 

Choose from 7 different light modes and 2 different luminous power settings (City Mode and Overland Mode).

Flashing Pattern:  "DOUBLE FLASH" / DAY / 60 % "CITY MODE" ( with strong sunlight / movie recording with sun-filter ):

 

Flashing Pattern: "DOUBLE FLASH" /  NIGHT / 60 % "CITY-MODE" ( movie recording with special-filter - the luminance is to high for the camera optics ): 

 

Flashing Pattern: "FLASHING ARROW TO THE LEFT" /  DAY / 60 % "CITY MODE" ( with strong sunlight / movie recording with sun-filter ):

 

Flashing Pattern: "FAST FLASHING" / DAY / 60 % "CITY MODE" ( with strong sunlight / movie recording with sun-filter ): 

 

Flashing Pattern: "CONTINUOUS LIGHT" / DAY / 60 % "CITY MODE" ( with strong sunlight / movie recording with sun-filter ):

 

Flashing Pattern:  "NIGHT - MIXED" / 60 % "CITY-MODE" ( movie recording with special-filter - the luminance is to high for the camera optics ):

 

Flashing Pattern: " HEDGING A GASOLINE TRANSPORTER ON A GAS STATION"  

 
 

Due to the use of altogether 21 individual state-of-the-art LED bulbs each with a high-precision lens, light distribution at close range and from a dis-tance is ultrabright, homogenous and straight to the point. To avoid dazz-ling of road users in cities it is possible to switch over to “city mode” providing for a reduction of luminance to 60%.

 

The installed GSM mobile telephone system with antenna booster ensures that the position and the emergency call can be transmitted instantly and independently of other mobile phones. IWARN® uses a stand-alone GSM module which has its own antenna booster and works with all GSM networks (GSM 850 / 900 / in 1800 / 1900 MHz and WCDMA 850 / 900 / 1900 / 2100 MHz) used worldwide. It is suitable for 3G and 4G (LTE) and will also work automatically in the future in a 5G network.  After pressing the ON/OFF button, IWARN® will search automatically and within a few seconds the GSM network having the best reception at the moment – no matter whether you are on a highway, in a town, on the sea or in a desert.

A particularly robust SIM chip of the Austrian market leader "A1" is incorporated in every IWARN®. "A1" is part of TELEKOM AUSTRIA. TELEKOM AUSTRIA was founded in 1887 and has to date more than 25 million customers. The specialised department “A1 Digital” focussing on IoT, the “Internet of Things”, ensures that IWARN® can always rely on state-of-the-art communication technology enabling ultrafast onward transfer of your IWARN® emergency call. For example, an alarm from the United States to Austria needs less than 1 second. 

More information:  https://www.telekomaustria.com

 

The installed stand-alone GPS determines the respective position with an accuracy of +/- 1.5 meters. Despite this exactness recognition takes only about 30 seconds. This system works with all 4 satellite networks: GPS (USA), Galileo (EUROPA), GLONASS (Russia) and BeiDou (China). Moreover, IWARN® is also equipped with the GPS variant “A-GPS”. This "assisted GPS" links with the mobile phone network and determines automatically the position via the mobile phone mast used by the GSM in case it is not possible to connect to one of the satellite networks in the sky.

 

We cooperate worldwide with commercial operators of emergency call centres of the police, ambulance services or leading automobile associations which are headquartered in the respective region. This ensures also that there are no language barriers and that the best rescue resources are used.The IWARN® emergency call centre is on duty 24/7, 365 days a year and is in direct contact permanently with the control centres of ambulance services, police, fire brigade, mountain rescue services, automobile associations, railway companies and motorway operators. The nearest rescue forces will be called to send you help. Now, the emergency call centre sends an acknowledgement signal to your IWARN®. Your IWARN® will put out a light signal to confirm the receipt of this message. So, you can be sure that your call was successful and that help is on its way.

 

 

From the very beginning, IWARN® has been designed for a maximum of mobile applications. Every time you are parking your car to go hiking, for example, or climbing in the mountains, mountainbiking, paragliding or making a ski tour, do not forget to bring your IWARN®. If you find yourself in an emergency situation, IWARN® will be your reliable lifesaver also off-road.

 

 

Owing to its extremely strong light IWARN® is recognised even from wide distances. This is ensured not only by the built-in emergency signal for mountainous regions but also by the two rechargeable heavy-duty batteries which ensure that IWARN® will be flashing in permanent operation for up to 3 days. When switching over IWARN® to continuous light you can use IWARN® as a very far reaching flashlight. Irrespective of the light signals, the built-in autonomous GSM transmitter and receiver as well as the integrated highly sensitive GPS system ensure that you can make a fully-automatic emergency call by indicating your exact position. So, the rescue helicopter will get your exact coordinates and when approaching the scene they will recognise your light signals from the air already for kilometers.

IWARN® comes with a special lifting lug that allows attaching it to your clothes or backpack using a carabine. Owing to its high quality in compliance with military standard MIL-STD-G850 it is vibration-resistant and insensitive to shocks and air pressure differences. Not to mention that IWARN® according to IP67 is water-proof and dust-tight.

 

 

As a standard feature, IWARN® allows pointing arrows to the left or to the right. When turning IWARN® by 90 degrees they are pointing up or down. With this signal, it is possible to show rescue helicopter pilots already from a great distance whether or not it is possible to land (arrow up: “DO NOT LAND – DANGER!” / arrow down: “LANDING POSSIBLE!”).

 

Every time you are parking your car to watersports to exercise,  do not forget  to bring your IWARN®.   If you find yourself in an emergency situation, IWARN® will be your reliable lifesaver on rivers, lakes and seas . ​The coast guard will get your exact coordinates and when approaching the scene they will recognise your light signals already for kilometres. ​ 

If your car has been stolen with IWARN® inside you can activate IWARN® via the installed GSM module by a simple call. You will receive then regular text messages from your activated IWARN® indicating the respective GPS positions. This will allow you to track your vehicle and to inform the police about the current position.

 

 

 

You have full access to the IWARN® - emergency call system in the following 84 countries:

ALBANIA . ARGENTINA . ARMENIA . AUSTRIA . AZERBAIJAN . BELARUS . BELGIUM . BOSNIA AND HERZEGOVINA . BRAZIL . BRITISH VIRGIN ISLANDS . BULGARIA . CAMBODIA . CANADA . CHILE . CHINA . COLOMBIA . CONGO (Dem. Rep.)  . COSTA RICA . CROATIA . CYPRUS . CZECH REPUBLIC . DENMARK . DOMINICAN REPUBLIC . ECUADOR . EGYPT . EL SALVADOR . ESTONIA . FINLAND . FRANCE . FRANCE CARAIBE . GEORGIA . GERMANY . GIBRALTAR . GREECE . GUATEMALA . HONG KONG . HUNGARY . ICELAND . INDIA . INDONESIA . IRELAND . ISRAEL . ITALY . LATVIA . LIECHTENSTEIN . LITHUANIA . LUXEMBOURG . MACEDONIA . MALAYSIA . MALTA . MEXICO . MOLDOVA . MONTENEGRO . NETHERLANDS . NEW ZEALAND . NICARAGUA . NIGERIA . NORWAY . PANAMA . PARAGUAY . PERU . POLAND . PORTUGAL . PUERTO RICO . QATAR . ROMANIA . RUSSIA . SERBIA . SEYCHELLES . SINGAPORE . SLOVAKIA . SLOVENIA . SOUTH AFRICA . SPAIN . SRI LANKA . SWEDEN . SWITZERLAND . TAJIKISTAN . THAILAND . TURKEY . UKRAINE . UNITED ARAB EMIRATES . UNITED KINGDOM . UNITED STATES OF AMERICA ​ ​

 

 

The purchase price of IWARN® already includes all costs for the lifetime of IWARN®. This means that no costs will incur for the unlocking of the SIM card nor will we charge monthly fees for the use of the emergency call centres or any other roaming fees. So, rest assured that your IWARN® will work when you need it.

 

 

We are working for future applications in professional areas (MILITARY, POLICE, FIRE SERVICE, RESCUE HELICOPTER, SCHOOL CROSSING GUARDS, HORSE-DRAWN CARRIAGES, CONSTRUCTION SAFETY ).

Please visit our homepage:   https://www.i-warn.com/applications

 

 

 

 

 
 
 
 

PROTOTYPE 1. Generation

 

PROTOTYPE 2nd. GENERATION

 

 
 
 

An accident is not child’s play. When you are in an emergency situation there is no room for errors. From the very beginning it was clear to us that IWARN® has to meet very special requirements. In order to cope with them reliably, we teamed up with various leading Styrian companies and pooled their know-how and production capacities in the form of a micro-cluster based in the West-Styrian town of Deutschlandsberg. All production-related processes are taken care of by "SVI". This is where the complete assembling of IWARN® is done and this is also from where IWARN® is exported worldwide. Short distances between the individual partners guarantee maximum flexibility and control. For example, the entire casing is produced by the Stainz-based company "Hiebler Kunststoffe" which is just 14 kilometres away from Deutschlandsberg. 

WELCOME TO THE PRODUCTION-LINE OF IWARN®:

 

With an R&D share of more than 4%, Styria – the “green heart of Austria” – ranks among Europe’s leading regions. Styria and its capital city of Graz are innovation centres in the Alps-Adriatic region. Five universities with more than 40,000 students, an internationally renowned system of universities of applied sciences and a great number of research centres make Styria the technology lab of Austria.

STYRIA - THIS IS THE DNA OF IWARN®:

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

We're a serious austrian start-up with a growing full-time team and a production ready working prototype.

We've finalized designs and teamed up with various leading Styrian companies and pooled their know-how and production capacities in the form of a micro-cluster. It's safe to say that we've reduced many of the risks typical of a hardware start-up. We will be working with austrian manufacturers who have years of experience delivering excellent products in tremendous quantities.

However, as with any newly manufactured product, it's possible for unexpected events (component delays and unexpected shortage) to impact the actual production time frame.

Our commitment to all of you, dear IWARN® customers, is that we will make every effort to deliver you an amazing product on time to safe you and your family.

Thank you for your trust!
