story:
​
 

 

 

MONO 20

 

(Mono20" 360˚ View)

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

MONO 26

NOTE : LCD will be a different one

 

(Mono26" 360˚ View)

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

MONO 20 FAT

NOTE : It will have CST tires instead of KENDA

(Mono20 Fatbike 360˚ View)

 

 

 

 

MORE STORIES about MONO

 

“RECON ebike to be spread all over the world” - E-daily
“RECONBIKE, the leading ebike company in Korea”- Economic Press
“RECON standing up in popularized ebike industrial ”-Asia news agency

Constructing the blueprint after 3D rendering simulation.

Smooth Welding

Mono used smooth welding procedure for the most visible parts for sharper look!

You would be able to tell the true difference once to get it in your hands!

This elaborate procedure with doubled weld seams has two advantages:

First, it improves the firmness of the weld seams and minimizes the load peaks on the tube welds through energy flow and on the other hand, it helps the frame to a better and more organic look due to the smooth and hardly noticeable welds.

The Internal Cables

The internally routed cables are not only protected inside of the frame from the dirt, sweat and road grime but also give the bike an organised appearance for your style. This involves several more manufacturing steps but we were more than willing to do it for you! 

INTEGRATED front and back lights

Be smart and have the lights integrated! They keep you safe during the night ride and make your bike looking nice and neat during the day. You can avoid having the bulky head and rear lights being attached on the frame, too! Just press the 'PAS level up' button longer for switching on and off! How simple!

Detachable battery

What is good about Mono? Our patented half-hidden-in-the-frame and detachable battery!

The battery pack nicely falls down along with the down tube so when you want to charge it, you can easily take the battery out! You can simply knock the key in, detach the battery in one second.  For re-attachment just tuck the battery in to the place where it was! There will be 2 keys given out to you to start with. If you happen to lose the key, contact us for another key set!

Mono battery harmonizes with the down tube and at the same time, it allows easy access so that you can take it with you anywhere to recharge.

There is a little button on the battery pack for you to press and see the battery gauge. So you will be able to constantly check how much is left to go without turning the screen on each time.

Let's have a closer look at the difference between tires.

In the video, you can our Mono 20 FAT(left) and Mono 20(right).

Mono 20 has 20"x1.75 KENDA tires for convenient city riding and Mono 20 FAT is equipped with 20"x4.0 CST tires for the steady riding in tougher conditions. eg slippery, snowy and etc.

Please NOTE : Mono FAT in the video has KENDA tires but the actual product delivered to you will be the one from CST. Mono 26 has 20"x1.75 KENDA tires.

 

LCD screen

LCD indicates the battery gauge, current speed (You can set in MPH or KMH), the PAS levels (from 0-5), whether the integrated lights are on or off and the total distance traveled. It also tell you the error code when something goes wrong and this can be the communication key between you and our engineers! eg. error code : 22 - throttle problem and etc.
 
Please note : the basic LCD set is provided as the above.
 

Adjustable to YOU

Our Mono series is adjustable. You can not only adjust the height of the seat but also the height of the handle! Each ring is about 0.4 inch (1cm) and there are 4~6 rings depending on the models to take out. It is not difficult to do it at home but if you do not have any tools, just visit your nearest bike shop for help!

MONO 20 Front Suspension

Our Mono 20 is even more special.  It has a front suspension which absorbs physical shocks applied the front wheel for easier riding on uphills, rough surfaces and pebbles. 

 

 

MONO SERIES SPECIFICATIONS

 

 

 

 

MONO in real life

 

MONO TIMELINE

** Our campaign is upon running with flexible goal, meaning you will definitely receive your perks regardless of whether the goal is reached or not.

 

RECONBIKE Collaboration

RECON’s wish for our next generations to be passed on with better environment.

Collaboration with SPINE from Italy.

RECON will be launching our Mono 20 and Mono 26 in Europe under the name of "SPINEBIKE" which is an Italian company. SPINE is very committed to develop a new way of e-mobility providing not only the products but service related to ebikes. With the theme of spreading the idea that ebikes are real solutions for everyday displacement, they proposed a coin rewarding system on their smart phone applications to promote people participation. 

 

Other Products From Recon

RECONBIKE is a leading ebike company in Korea.
We are supported by RECON lovers who pursue our own design, passion to create better ebikes and the product ranges we introduce at the beginning of year each.

 

CONNECT WITH US

RECONBIKE WEBSITE

www.reconbikes.com

INSTAGRAM

http://www.instagram.com/reconbike_official/

https://www.instagram.com/reconbike/

FACEBOOK

http://www.facebook.com/reconhightech

 

 

Frequently Asked Questions

 

Q: What is "RECON"?

A: Many of you guys may have heard or seen us at different trade show over the world. Recon HI-TECH is the name of our ebike company that has been upon running for 4 years. We came to create Mono series which superior others design-wise and functionality-wise after several years of developing all kinds of models from city ebikes to eMTBs. 

 

Q: How is "Mono" crafted?

A: Our design team in conjunction with our engineers created RECON's own frame that you can't find anywhere else. This is how we came across with the name of "Mono" which implies its "uniqueness". Along with Mono, we wanted you to be "the one" who follows the simple and modern life style. 

At the top of this design, we found a way to put a battery that can be be easily detachable for your convenience.

 We added both of PAS (Pedal Assist System) AND a throttle, so that you can choose whichever to fulfill your needs.  We market-tested our Mono series locally in Korea and upgraded with the features that overseas users might prefer, such as a LCD indicator in mileage. With your support, we would be able to precede the final production phase for you! 

 

Q: What are the differences among Mono 20, Mono 26 and Mono 20 FAT?

A: Firstly, they differ in the size of the wheel. The number indicates its wheel size in inches.

Our Mono 20 is designed for everyone to easily hope on. Anyone taller than 5.15 ft would have no trouble riding our Mono 20.

Mono 26 is for everyone but might be preferred who are taller than 5.75 foot because it frame is designed to be higher than Mono 20.

Mono 20 FAT is for everyone who are more sporty, riding Mono in slippery, snowy and sandy environment.

 

Q: Is the brake system safe?

A: For riders safety, Mono series is built with a disc brake system which differs from the rim brakes. While rim brakes get easily heated up, cause the tires to wear and become weak on the wet surfaces, the disc brakes can endure the tougher riding conditions and after the long term use, you can simply replace the disc brake rotors rather than having to change the whole set.

 

Q: What are PAS and throttle functions?

A: There are two distinctive electric functions. One called PAS; pedal assist system, the other a throttle.

If you want to ride Mono just like normal bicycles, you can do so with the PAS level 0 while still being able to check the current speed, distance traveled, battery gauge, integrated lights and etc.

For PAS system, you will be getting extra help from the motor WHILE pedaling by clicking the up and down buttons near the left handle bar grip. There are 6 different levels from 0 to 5.  0 being just like normal bicycles with no help from the motor at all. Higher the level gets, stronger the power you will be getting.

Throttle, is something you would want to use when you want to cruise without pedaling and ride it like a motorbike. Just twist the thumb throttle near the right side of the handle bar.

 

Q: How is the effective exercise possible with Mono?

A: To start with, you can ride Mono just like a non-ebike for exercising while being able to check the current speed, distance traveled and whenever you are frustrated, you can get help from the motor and ride further distance at steady exercise level for effective aerobic exercise. Aerobic exercise, as you might have already know, burns up calories which can in turn help you shed excess weight and be healthier! 

I guarantee, you will go outside, ride Mono and utilize it more often in your everyday life for your transportation and health because you have less stress about having to do a hard out leg work.

 

Q: How does the battery get recharged? Does it self-recharge?

A: Mono battery is half hidden in the frame. You can simply detach it in a matter of a second and plug it on the wall to recharge it. It does not provide any self-recharging function because it is just not cost-effective to have it integrated and it only causes the resistance back to itself which will again takes more energy to push further.

 

Q: How long does it take to fully recharge the battery?

A: For Mono 20 and Mono 26, it takes approximately 4 hours. For Mono FAT, approximately 4.5~5 hours. With our fast charger, it will only take around 2.5 hours to fully recharge!

 

Q: How long is the battery lifespan?

A: Normally, the lithium ion battery lifespan will be decreased to around 80% after 800 cycles.

 

Q: The battery is exposed to the outside. Does it come with water-resistance features?

A: Yes. It is half hidden, meaning it is also half-exposed for the ease of detachment and recharging. It would be OK to ride on rainy days, but it is recommended to make sure you wipe the wet surface with dry towel for storage after the use.

 

Q: Would it be possible to purchase a spare battery?

A: Yes. Of course! You can get "a spare battery perk" for yourself. If you need another pack after the campaign, you would always be able get it from us directly and you will need to as Mono batteries are specialized for Mono only. I recommend getting it NOW to save your money and shipping costs!

 

Q: What would be the range (distance covered with a single charge)?

A: In PAS level 1 with pedaling, it can cover the estimated range of 50 miles (80km) and when throttle is in use (full electric), the estimated range is 15.5 MPH (25km). The range may be differ depending on the geography of riding, weight of the rider and other factors.

 

Q: How fast is it?

A: In PAS(pedal assist system) mode with Mono 20 and Mono 26 (8.8Ah batteries) , you can reach the maximum speed of 21.7MPH (35KMH) and in throttle mode, 12.5MPH (20KMH). However, there will be the speed limit programmed to meet the regulations of 20 MPH (32KMH). You can reprogram it to follow your country regulations. 

Mono FAT (10.4Ah battery) can reach the maximum speed of 27.9MPH (45KMH) in PAS mode and 18.5MPH (30KMH) when throttle is in use. So, please check if Mono FAT with 500W is allowed in your regions before backing us!

 

Q: What can I do when battery goes flat while riding?

A: Do not panic. You can simply ride it like regular bicycles by pedaling or find a power supplier to recharge your battery. Alternately, you can get a perk for a spare battery which is only 6 pounds (2.8kg) approximately. Then you will be ready to boost for another round in one second!

 

Q: Is it safe to use?

A: Yes. There is BMS circuit that controls the battery and prevents it from the over-current and over-voltage for your safety. If there is something wrong electronically, there will be an error code appearing on the LCD screen in 2 digits number.

 

Q: How to read error codes?

A: The errors codes are the key for the communication and identifying the problems caused electronically. Please follow the chart to figure out what is an issue.

 

Q: What happens if the campaign does not reach the goal?

A: Don't worry! We will still keep the promise and send you the perks to your door!

 

Q: How does the perk come to my door?

A: Everything will come in one box. There will be a mini tooling set for you to get your bike ready for a ride as well as the instructions on how to screw to pedals, handle bar and the front wheel for the completion!

 

Q: What about the part for replacements?

A: You can always get all the components from us. However, apart from the battery and the key set, the parts are standard so you can get it from the local bike shop for repair, upgrades and customization. 

 

Q: What is the maximum load?

A: The Maximum load is approximately 265 pounds. It is made of aluminium alloy which is the most widely used material for bike frame and well known for its strength and safety.

 

Q: Do I need a license to ride MONO?

A: Yes for US and no for EU. Our Mono 20 an Mono 26 are equipped with 350W following the US regulations and Mono 20 FAT with 500W for some regions. You can check the regulations according to your state at here.  This is the reason why we do not delivery the perks to Europe countries but to US, Canada, Korea and China. Our Mono series has the capacity of riding at the maximum speed given at the above chart but will have the limits set up to 20mph (32km/h) which is adjustable with reprogramming. 

 

Q: I live in Europe and want Mono series. What do I do?

A: RECON is working in conjunction with SPINE from Italy for launching Mono 20 and Mono 26 with SPINE's application technology in several months. Please contact info@spinebike.com for more information.

 

Q: Who is responsible for TAX, DUTY and VAT?

A: It is 0% in US and Korea. Please check with your customs and government or contact us.

 

Q: How to contact us?

A: You can either email us to iris@reconbike.com or call +1-213.295.3330 / +82-70-4261-7553.
story_txt:
​ 
 
 
MONO 20










 

(Mono20" 360˚ View)


 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
MONO 26
NOTE : LCD will be a different one
 









(Mono26" 360˚ View)


 
 
 
 
 
 
 
MONO 20 FAT
NOTE : It will have CST tires instead of KENDA








(Mono20 Fatbike 360˚ View)


 
 
 
 
MORE STORIES about MONO
 

“RECON ebike to be spread all over the world” - E-daily“RECONBIKE, the leading ebike company in Korea”- Economic Press“RECON standing up in popularized ebike industrial ”-Asia news agency

Constructing the blueprint after 3D rendering simulation.



Smooth Welding
Mono used smooth welding procedure for the most visible parts for sharper look!
You would be able to tell the true difference once to get it in your hands!
This elaborate procedure with doubled weld seams has two advantages:
First, it improves the firmness of the weld seams and minimizes the load peaks on the tube welds through energy flow and on the other hand, it helps the frame to a better and more organic look due to the smooth and hardly noticeable welds.

The Internal Cables
The internally routed cables are not only protected inside of the frame from the dirt, sweat and road grime but also give the bike an organised appearance for your style. This involves several more manufacturing steps but we were more than willing to do it for you! 



INTEGRATED front and back lights

Be smart and have the lights integrated! They keep you safe during the night ride and make your bike looking nice and neat during the day. You can avoid having the bulky head and rear lights being attached on the frame, too! Just press the 'PAS level up' button longer for switching on and off! How simple!


Detachable battery
What is good about Mono? Our patented half-hidden-in-the-frame and detachable battery!
The battery pack nicely falls down along with the down tube so when you want to charge it, you can easily take the battery out! You can simply knock the key in, detach the battery in one second.  For re-attachment just tuck the battery in to the place where it was! There will be 2 keys given out to you to start with. If you happen to lose the key, contact us for another key set!
Mono battery harmonizes with the down tube and at the same time, it allows easy access so that you can take it with you anywhere to recharge.
There is a little button on the battery pack for you to press and see the battery gauge. So you will be able to constantly check how much is left to go without turning the screen on each time.



Let's have a closer look at the difference between tires.
In the video, you can our Mono 20 FAT(left) and Mono 20(right).
Mono 20 has 20"x1.75 KENDA tires for convenient city riding and Mono 20 FAT is equipped with 20"x4.0 CST tires for the steady riding in tougher conditions. eg slippery, snowy and etc.
Please NOTE : Mono FAT in the video has KENDA tires but the actual product delivered to you will be the one from CST. Mono 26 has 20"x1.75 KENDA tires.


 

LCD screen
LCD indicates the battery gauge, current speed (You can set in MPH or KMH), the PAS levels (from 0-5), whether the integrated lights are on or off and the total distance traveled. It also tell you the error code when something goes wrong and this can be the communication key between you and our engineers! eg. error code : 22 - throttle problem and etc.
 

Please note : the basic LCD set is provided as the above.
 

Adjustable to YOU
Our Mono series is adjustable. You can not only adjust the height of the seat but also the height of the handle! Each ring is about 0.4 inch (1cm) and there are 4~6 rings depending on the models to take out. It is not difficult to do it at home but if you do not have any tools, just visit your nearest bike shop for help!

MONO 20 Front Suspension
Our Mono 20 is even more special.  It has a front suspension which absorbs physical shocks applied the front wheel for easier riding on uphills, rough surfaces and pebbles. 
 

 
MONO SERIES SPECIFICATIONS
 
 
 

 
MONO in real life

 
MONO TIMELINE

** Our campaign is upon running with flexible goal, meaning you will definitely receive your perks regardless of whether the goal is reached or not.
 
RECONBIKE Collaboration

RECON’s wish for our next generations to be passed on with better environment.
Collaboration with SPINE from Italy.
RECON will be launching our Mono 20 and Mono 26 in Europe under the name of "SPINEBIKE" which is an Italian company. SPINE is very committed to develop a new way of e-mobility providing not only the products but service related to ebikes. With the theme of spreading the idea that ebikes are real solutions for everyday displacement, they proposed a coin rewarding system on their smart phone applications to promote people participation. 
 
Other Products From Recon

RECONBIKE is a leading ebike company in Korea.We are supported by RECON lovers who pursue our own design, passion to create better ebikes and the product ranges we introduce at the beginning of year each.
 
CONNECT WITH US
RECONBIKE WEBSITE
www.reconbikes.com
INSTAGRAM
http://www.instagram.com/reconbike_official/
https://www.instagram.com/reconbike/
FACEBOOK
http://www.facebook.com/reconhightech
  Frequently Asked Questions Q: What is "RECON"?A: Many of you guys may have heard or seen us at different trade show over the world. Recon HI-TECH is the name of our ebike company that has been upon running for 4 years. We came to create Mono series which superior others design-wise and functionality-wise after several years of developing all kinds of models from city ebikes to eMTBs.  Q: How is "Mono" crafted?A: Our design team in conjunction with our engineers created RECON's own frame that you can't find anywhere else. This is how we came across with the name of "Mono" which implies its "uniqueness". Along with Mono, we wanted you to be "the one" who follows the simple and modern life style. At the top of this design, we found a way to put a battery that can be be easily detachable for your convenience. We added both of PAS (Pedal Assist System) AND a throttle, so that you can choose whichever to fulfill your needs.  We market-tested our Mono series locally in Korea and upgraded with the features that overseas users might prefer, such as a LCD indicator in mileage. With your support, we would be able to precede the final production phase for you!  Q: What are the differences among Mono 20, Mono 26 and Mono 20 FAT?A: Firstly, they differ in the size of the wheel. The number indicates its wheel size in inches.Our Mono 20 is designed for everyone to easily hope on. Anyone taller than 5.15 ft would have no trouble riding our Mono 20.Mono 26 is for everyone but might be preferred who are taller than 5.75 foot because it frame is designed to be higher than Mono 20.Mono 20 FAT is for everyone who are more sporty, riding Mono in slippery, snowy and sandy environment. Q: Is the brake system safe?A: For riders safety, Mono series is built with a disc brake system which differs from the rim brakes. While rim brakes get easily heated up, cause the tires to wear and become weak on the wet surfaces, the disc brakes can endure the tougher riding conditions and after the long term use, you can simply replace the disc brake rotors rather than having to change the whole set. Q: What are PAS and throttle functions?A: There are two distinctive electric functions. One called PAS; pedal assist system, the other a throttle.If you want to ride Mono just like normal bicycles, you can do so with the PAS level 0 while still being able to check the current speed, distance traveled, battery gauge, integrated lights and etc.For PAS system, you will be getting extra help from the motor WHILE pedaling by clicking the up and down buttons near the left handle bar grip. There are 6 different levels from 0 to 5.  0 being just like normal bicycles with no help from the motor at all. Higher the level gets, stronger the power you will be getting.Throttle, is something you would want to use when you want to cruise without pedaling and ride it like a motorbike. Just twist the thumb throttle near the right side of the handle bar. Q: How is the effective exercise possible with Mono?A: To start with, you can ride Mono just like a non-ebike for exercising while being able to check the current speed, distance traveled and whenever you are frustrated, you can get help from the motor and ride further distance at steady exercise level for effective aerobic exercise. Aerobic exercise, as you might have already know, burns up calories which can in turn help you shed excess weight and be healthier! I guarantee, you will go outside, ride Mono and utilize it more often in your everyday life for your transportation and health because you have less stress about having to do a hard out leg work. Q: How does the battery get recharged? Does it self-recharge?A: Mono battery is half hidden in the frame. You can simply detach it in a matter of a second and plug it on the wall to recharge it. It does not provide any self-recharging function because it is just not cost-effective to have it integrated and it only causes the resistance back to itself which will again takes more energy to push further. Q: How long does it take to fully recharge the battery?A: For Mono 20 and Mono 26, it takes approximately 4 hours. For Mono FAT, approximately 4.5~5 hours. With our fast charger, it will only take around 2.5 hours to fully recharge! Q: How long is the battery lifespan?A: Normally, the lithium ion battery lifespan will be decreased to around 80% after 800 cycles. Q: The battery is exposed to the outside. Does it come with water-resistance features?A: Yes. It is half hidden, meaning it is also half-exposed for the ease of detachment and recharging. It would be OK to ride on rainy days, but it is recommended to make sure you wipe the wet surface with dry towel for storage after the use. Q: Would it be possible to purchase a spare battery?A: Yes. Of course! You can get "a spare battery perk" for yourself. If you need another pack after the campaign, you would always be able get it from us directly and you will need to as Mono batteries are specialized for Mono only. I recommend getting it NOW to save your money and shipping costs! Q: What would be the range (distance covered with a single charge)?A: In PAS level 1 with pedaling, it can cover the estimated range of 50 miles (80km) and when throttle is in use (full electric), the estimated range is 15.5 MPH (25km). The range may be differ depending on the geography of riding, weight of the rider and other factors. Q: How fast is it?A: In PAS(pedal assist system) mode with Mono 20 and Mono 26 (8.8Ah batteries) , you can reach the maximum speed of 21.7MPH (35KMH) and in throttle mode, 12.5MPH (20KMH). However, there will be the speed limit programmed to meet the regulations of 20 MPH (32KMH). You can reprogram it to follow your country regulations. Mono FAT (10.4Ah battery) can reach the maximum speed of 27.9MPH (45KMH) in PAS mode and 18.5MPH (30KMH) when throttle is in use. So, please check if Mono FAT with 500W is allowed in your regions before backing us! Q: What can I do when battery goes flat while riding?A: Do not panic. You can simply ride it like regular bicycles by pedaling or find a power supplier to recharge your battery. Alternately, you can get a perk for a spare battery which is only 6 pounds (2.8kg) approximately. Then you will be ready to boost for another round in one second! Q: Is it safe to use?A: Yes. There is BMS circuit that controls the battery and prevents it from the over-current and over-voltage for your safety. If there is something wrong electronically, there will be an error code appearing on the LCD screen in 2 digits number. Q: How to read error codes?A: The errors codes are the key for the communication and identifying the problems caused electronically. Please follow the chart to figure out what is an issue. Q: What happens if the campaign does not reach the goal?A: Don't worry! We will still keep the promise and send you the perks to your door! Q: How does the perk come to my door?A: Everything will come in one box. There will be a mini tooling set for you to get your bike ready for a ride as well as the instructions on how to screw to pedals, handle bar and the front wheel for the completion! Q: What about the part for replacements?A: You can always get all the components from us. However, apart from the battery and the key set, the parts are standard so you can get it from the local bike shop for repair, upgrades and customization.  Q: What is the maximum load?A: The Maximum load is approximately 265 pounds. It is made of aluminium alloy which is the most widely used material for bike frame and well known for its strength and safety. Q: Do I need a license to ride MONO?A: Yes for US and no for EU. Our Mono 20 an Mono 26 are equipped with 350W following the US regulations and Mono 20 FAT with 500W for some regions. You can check the regulations according to your state at here.  This is the reason why we do not delivery the perks to Europe countries but to US, Canada, Korea and China. Our Mono series has the capacity of riding at the maximum speed given at the above chart but will have the limits set up to 20mph (32km/h) which is adjustable with reprogramming.  Q: I live in Europe and want Mono series. What do I do?A: RECON is working in conjunction with SPINE from Italy for launching Mono 20 and Mono 26 with SPINE's application technology in several months. Please contact info@spinebike.com for more information. Q: Who is responsible for TAX, DUTY and VAT?A: It is 0% in US and Korea. story:
We are ready to build our Beetle and travel around Europe driven by the Sun!


Its time to demonstrate that oil-free and grid-free transportation is here and looks good!



It's simple.

You park it around the block and it charges from the solar array, enough to take you to work and around town everyday.

If you need to drive an extra distance, you have you an extra power reserve,but now you have to top it up in small doses the folowing days.

Its all calculated that you don't ever have to plug it on grid.

That's the target.

That way you are energy sufficient.

Now you can drive your daily route all year long with no ''fuel''.

Propably you can't take big trips yet, but for now, town commuting is free.

It's possible.

Five years back it was unreachable.

Two years back it was furiously expensive.

Now we can make it happen!

We can do it.

The key factor is efficiency.

Only the top-end materials and technologies matched together can give the wanted result.

We will use record breaking sollar cells of 24.5% efficiency that are already available on the market!

We will match them with titanate-lithium cells that offer unbelievable charging-discharging and kw/kg rates

We will drive the vehicle with 97-98% efficiency motor-controller compo.


We are ready to share our passion!


A whole new aspect of self-sufficient vehicles that need nothing but a parking space to get you to work every day.


Even the small daily range of 50km  should not be underestimated as it will prove in real-time that energy-free transportation can happen.

After all, most of us drive smaller distances than that to go to work and around town every day.

But why bother building a Solar Electric car?

Firstly because we love electric vehicles.

From bicycles to small trikes and light aircrafts and cars we are constantly building projects like that for fun.

Our expertise and working field is on power electronics and batteries we have an engineer in the group and a carbon fiber laminator as well!

A bunch of tech-lovers that put everything on the table and push theirselfes to find new possible answers.

What motivates as, is the fact that scientific and technological resources are finally ready  to trigger a revolution in transportation.

Modern cars are well built for their purpose, but urban and city traffic makes them bulky and expensive to use when compared to public transportation.

In the era of electric formula cars and publicly available technology we decided that we can be part of those to explore and overcome every obstacle on the way to energy sufficient solar vehicles.



How will we do that?

We targeted to use an electric configuration that reaches the highest efficiencies on the market to get the most out of the battery bank.

Most of the parts on the project are available on the market and match perfect with new battery chemistries to deliver power to weight ratios suitable even for ultralight aircrafts.

We want to prove that even a very small budget can make revolutionary difference in everyday life.

All that paired with extremely well balanced perfomance specs that mean calculated acceleration forces and high regenerative braking get the project literally ahead.


That's all the mechanical parts, 20kw power-30kg weight

Last and most important factor though is weight, as in city driving speeds specially weight dictates the amount of energy an object needs to cover distances.

That’s something that needs attention as long as modern cars tend to go heavier and heavier and that is also the reason we looked for the lightest candidates.

We need to stay in budget and build a car that has the weight of a custom-made carbon monocoque project worthing hundreds thousands of dollars.

To do that we know we have to sacrifice our aerodynamic drag and just use an old light donor car removing as much weight as possible under budget.

We calculate that in city driving,slow speeds will counterbalace for the raised drag and save as from building a whole new body for the project.

At last we decided to use a VW beetle,a very simple and light donor car that can accomodate enough solar cells for the project!

That way we dont have to put much effort,sources and time to build a custom lightweight  body.

This little car using aftermarket parts and exotic materials can get lighter than 450 kg fully converted and has all the potential to be a classy ultra-tech solar car that works great for our project.




Risks and challenges

Our target goal is to build a daily driving vehicle that covers its energy needs on solar energy. 
We set the value of 50km as our first threshold based on available technology today,our funds and also on estimated daily needs, as we calculated that a big part of daily transportation needs are covered for most of the people with less than 50 km range.

We are targeting for a vehicle usefull even for cloudy days or some bigger distances. 


Cloudy days can give enough solar energy for a part of the range but the battery bank will be enough for more than 200km distance. 

That way the user will not have to worry at all about weather changes or some bigger trips as long ,daily needs are in the 50km range.

So if you cover daily,for instance 40km,you can each saturday have a 110km trip and have it all charged up until the next saturday or have 200km trip each 15 days etc.

All our calculations based on our experience in smaller electric vehicles and solar energy knowledge ,makes us confident that even if unknown to that pioneering project variants get in the way,that will only affect the final range of the vehicle to a small point.

The fact that a small funded,normal looking classic car would be able to travel distances and cover daily transportation needs in a big city producing its own energy from the sun,for us already looks a big success.

Our planning to this point concludes all numbers data,parts pricing and assets and we are confident that the project will be exactly what we are waiting for.Full of experiences and our first step to this new level of technological revolution

story:
Hello!  My name is Jaime Chapman and I love pedicabs... driving them, riding in them, and expressing myself on them (see photos of me riding a pedicab in Key West below).  Soon, I will be sharing my environmentally friendly passion with the city of Reno with my "Pineapple Pedicab" business.

 

A little bit about me: I have always been passionate about the outdoors, biking, exploring and meeting new people.  Last spring, at this time, I was in the middle of my 1,200 mile bike ride, starting in Long Beach and riding all the way to Cabo, by myself and on a bike that I built out of all recycled parts!  I built my bike (Tankerita) for a whopping $85, using parts that people were throwing away, the only new parts on my bike were the bike seat, chain, tubes and cables!  I loved that my bike was as environmentally friendly as she could possibly get.  However, I am not building my pedicab out of recycled parts.  She was made in 2015 in Phoenix, AZ by a company called Media Pedicabs.  

 

I am starting with one pedicab with me being the only driver, but my dream is to have a whole fleet of Pineapple Pedicabs pedaling around Reno.  My goal is to provide more options for transportation and also bring employment opportunities to the local economy.

 

I drove a pedicab for several years in Key West, FL.  Here are some pictures of me on the pedicabs featured in a popular Key West magazine/ social site, Mile Zero Mag.

 

Valentines Day Pedicab ride!

 

Pedaling around some Key West locals.

 

Super Soaker Season in Key West!

 

Ways You Can Help

If you are not interested in pre-buying your pedicab ride now, I could always use your thoughts and ideas!

  • Purchase the advertising space on the back of my pedicab, message me for information
  • Sponsorships (shoes, hydration drinks, sunscreen, athletic apparel, ect.)
  • Ideas on how to get my name out to tourist visiting Reno
  • Ideas on neat tours I could offer to tourist, or locals!
  • All ideas welcome and appreciated 

 

The Impact

  • Provide a new and fun mode of transportation to Reno
  • Environmentally friendly
  • Adds to the unique aesthetics of Reno
  • Provide health promoting employment for locals
story_txt:
Hello!  My name is Jaime Chapman and I love pedicabs... driving them, riding in them, and expressing myself on them (see photos of me riding a pedicab in Key West below).  Soon, I will be sharing my environmentally friendly passion with the city of Reno with my "Pineapple Pedicab" business.
 
A little bit about me: I have always been passionate about the outdoors, biking, exploring and meeting new people.  Last spring, at this time, I was in the middle of my 1,200 mile bike ride, starting in Long Beach and riding all the way to Cabo, by myself and on a bike that I built out of all recycled parts!  I built my bike (Tankerita) for a whopping $85, using parts that people were throwing away, the only new parts on my bike were the bike seat, chain, tubes and cables!  I loved that my bike was as environmentally friendly as she could possibly get.  However, I am not building my pedicab out of recycled parts.  She was made in 2015 in Phoenix, AZ by a company called Media Pedicabs.  
 
I am starting with one pedicab with me being the only driver, but my dream is to have a whole fleet of Pineapple Pedicabs pedaling around Reno.  My goal is to provide more options for transportation and also bring employment opportunities to the local economy.
 
I drove a pedicab for several years in Key West, FL.  Here are some pictures of me on the pedicabs featured in a popular Key West magazine/ social site, Mile Zero Mag.
 
Valentines Day Pedicab ride!

 
Pedaling around some Key West locals.

 
Super Soaker Season in Key West!

 
Ways You Can Help
If you are not interested in pre-buying your pedicab ride now, I could always use your thoughts and ideas!

Purchase the advertising space on the back of my pedicab, message me for information
Sponsorships (shoes, hydration drinks, sunscreen, athletic apparel, ect.)
Ideas on how to get my name out to tourist visiting Reno
Ideas on neat tours I could offer to tourist, or locals!
All ideas welcome and appreciated 

 
The Impact

Provide a new and fun mode of transportation to Reno
Environmentally friendly
Adds to the unique aesthetics of Reno
Provide health promoting employment for locals

story:
Ebike Cargo Products is bringing you the future of bicycle transportation today.

With current Ebike technology and our Velocker cargo panniers, sustainable transportation is now within reach. Our lightweight, locking, durable bike boxes can handle all of your goods and gear, and are compatible with nearly all bicycle racks.


 

 

 

 

Velocker Production:

story:
It's 7:18 AM on Monday morning and you need to be at work by 8 AM sharp.

You throw on clothes, grab a cup of coffee, and are out the door lickity-split. Without giving your car a second thought, you drive off...

Halfway to work the "Check Engine" light blinks on and a thick cloud of smoke billows out of your tail pipe into traffic.

You're now living through an invisible, multi-billion dollar problem faced by drivers worldwide. A problem that big oil companies want you to ignore...

Average gas mileage for new passenger cars has stagnated around 22 MPG for the last 20 years. Traditional engines only deliver a 30% tank-to-wheel efficiency at best.

Cars are generally discarded after 153,000  miles (NHTSA) due to the stress and heat caused by friction inside the engine, which leads to lost compression and efficiency. Engines wear out quickly and cost thousands to repair when something eventually breaks.

Millions of cars end up in landfills every year as they wear out and become too costly to maintain. Toxic heavy metals, oils, and other chemicals end up in our storm drains and water supplies when once loved cars end up as waste.

Solution 

TriboTEX stands at the forefront of a huge revolution in tiny nanoparticles. We’ll show you how TriboTEX can improve your engine in 15 minutes, but first let’s look at the technology behind it...

It’s like the ceramic protective coatings used in some high-performance engines, but it reduces friction 10X BETTER than engine oil alone. In engine tests we discovered that:

  • Fuel economy performance increased by 6-8% in a car with 130K+ miles while increasing in-cylinder compression.
  • As the nice round cylinders wear in your engine, they become more elliptical which decreases engine performance. TriboTEX forms a film on the worn parts of the cylinder making it rounder and increasing compression. Essentially the engine repairs itself as the coating goes to work. 
  • Engine noise drops dramatically. On idle your engine noise will be so low, your neighbors may not even hear your car in the morning :-) and your mechanic will hear your injectors as the dominant source of a noise.
  • Easily adds 3%+ more power under your hood without disassembly.
  • Your engine will run cooler which increases the life of gaskets, seals, and bearing surfaces.

What TriboTEX doesn’t do is just as important. TriboTEX won’t... 

  • Ruin your catalytic converter on newer cars like other oil additives (ZDDP) 
  • Pollute the environment because all TriboTEX ingredients are environmentally friendly 
  • Leave you wondering “if it’s working”. You’ll feel & hear it as soon as 15 minutes after application, due to the coating affecting the journal bearings. The performance boost will come later when your cylinders get coated.

We’ve been awarded over $1,000,000 in grants from the National Science Foundation and other agencies to conduct research and make our material in large production quantities. Now we need you to bring TriboTEX to life in your vehicle.

We're ready to reveal TriboTEX to YOU, our first customers!


Take your car out for a drive to warm the engine up. You want to make sure your engine is warm before applying TriboTEX.


Open your oil filler cap and squeeze all 20 ml of the proprietary nanomaterial into your engine or oil tank.
 



Idle the engine for 15 minutes to allow the engine oil to mix with TriboTEX.
 



After putting another 500 miles on your car (about 2 full tanks), your gas mileage will experience the full effect of TriboTEX at work.


Apply another coating of TriboTEX AFTER driving another 40,000 miles. 

Yes, it lasts that long! One syringe is enough to treat 3-8 quarts of oil. Just add extra applications if your car or truck takes more oil.





 

What We’ve Achieved Up To Now

By backing our campaign, you will be one of the first people in the world to experience how nanotechnology is changing the way people drive. 

TriboTEX has been in hundreds of lab tests and in live on-the-road tests with dozens of our friends' cars. TriboTEX has shown to provide the benefits of higher gas mileage, more horsepower, and reduced wear in the real world.

We've bench marked our formula against other additives on the market and believe we offer drivers the best value:


TriboTEX works in all engine types, including gasoline, diesel, turbo, big and small. We have tested TriboTEX on countless vehicles, such as the Ford Mustang, F-150, BMWs, Hondas, Nissans, Chevy 1500 and Dodge Ram. We are certain TriboTEX will work in your specific car.  



Orders are shipping via USPS within two (2) business days of ordering. For information on the status of your order please contact us at: support@tribotex.com 

You will receive an email with tracking information titled: Your TriboTEX is on its way

Our fulfillment center is up and running!
 

We have inventory to ship and we are making more every day!

story:
Short Summary

Good Day
With the consensus agreement of the 2015 United Nations Climate Change Conference, COP 21 or CMP 11 held in Paris, France, from 30 November to 12 December 2015; this seems the most apropos time to launch my "Green" vehicle engine campaign.  I will start with a brief career overview.  I have completed 35 years of Canadian Military service within which I was a Project Officer for 8 years conducting Tests and Evaluations of Military aircraft systems.  After retirement from the military my wife and I purchased a small business where we turned around a company that was last in sales in the district, of 13 like stores, to become number one in sales in five years.  
This campaign is important to me as the funds will be utilized to develop an energy system which will ELIMINATE automobile CO2 emissions contributing to Global Warming (ranges of 53-164 tons of CO2 per vehicle).  By eliminating these CO2 gases (plus others) we will help contribute to a better world for my, and your, children and grand-children. My 'Zero Emissions Self-Sustaining Engine' (ZESSE) [Patent Pending] will do just that.

What We Need & What You Get

Funding Required: to date I have contributed approximately $10,000 to my project and have set a goal of reaching $500,000+.  Once the engineering team and infrastructure is in place, I have set a time-line of 3-6 months for complete vehicle build and test.  This funding will be used for the Development team wages, Business expenses; Prototype Engines, "Glider vehicle", vehicle construction, Test & Evaluation, and trade show expenses. 

Perks will be a ZESSE T-shirt for those able to contribute $100, or more, (a base limit is set due to purchase/delivery costs involved).  

Any funds collected will be put towards the development and testing of the ZESSE engine even if the entire goal is not reached.  It will come to life; the more funding received, the faster ZESSE can become a reality and the sooner we can start cleaning up the air we are breathing.

The Impact

Major factors for supporting my goal are two-fold; first is the monetary savings you will personally receive.  The average vehicle operating expenses, gas/oil etc, range from a compact car driving 12,000km/yr at $1,743.60 - to a large SUV driving 32,000km/yr at $5,334.40 {CAA DATA}.  This money could be in YOUR wallet - "Never Pay For Fuel Again".  Secondly you will have the knowledge you are contributing to the elimination of one of the major causes of air pollution and Global Warming.   Even plug-in electric vehicles create pollution - they just off-load it to the power stations which have to produce more energy to meet the demands (see statement from U.S. Dept of Energy, below).   

Comparing Well-to-Wheel Greenhouse Gas Emissions

Compare greenhouse gas emissions and fuel costs for a selection of common conventional and electric drive vehicles for a 100-mile trip in the table below.

Emissions and Fuel Cost for a 100-mile trip
Vehicle
(compact sedans)		 Greenhouse Gas Emissions
(pounds of CO2 equivalent)		 Total Fuel Cost
(U.S. Dollars)
Conventional 99 lb CO2 $11.60
Hybrid Electric 51 lb CO2 $5.96
Plug-in Hybrid Electric 61 lb CO2 $6.78
All-Electric 54 lb CO2 $3.56


My engine design has ZERO EMISSIONS and is SELF-SUSTAINING, so there is no off-load to the power grid.


Risks & Challenges

The ZESSE design was developed on the same principle of the Nuclear Submarine power system, I selected this system due to it's unique closed-cycle design.  There are two major changes.  It is obviously scaled down to fit within the confines of a vehicle engine compartment and, most-importantly, the 'Nuclear' aspect has been eliminated. To replace the 'Nuclear' functional duties, I have incorporated Microwave emitters similar in nature to the Microwave oven you use on a daily basis.  These two proven technologies have been in world-wide use for decades. The challenges that lay ahead are funding and, Engineering the fine-tuning aspects of combining these two technologies into an effective and efficient manner.  I do not see this challenge as insurmountable as Design and Testing will be conducted utilizing CAD (Computer Aided Design) software before actual construction becomes a reality.  I believe my military and business background give me the experience and business acumen to bring ZESSE to life.

Other Ways You Can Help

All levels of contributions are important but there are some people who just can't contribute on a monetary level, that doesn't mean you can't help.  I would ask that you help by getting the word out via your social media contacts, friends and family.  The more people in the know, the better chances of achieving funding success.
Check out my web site at "Zesse.ca" or "ZessePowerSystems.com" to view the proposed test vehicle for Zesse and to view a short animation on how Zesse will operate.

As a reminder you can utilize the Indiegogo share tools!

I know your time is valuable and I appreciate that you have taken this time to view my project.

Footnote:  I have recently viewed a film "Racing Extinction", which gives an extremely good overview of the damage we, as a species, are doing to our planet.  It is well worth the two hours to view this documentary.  Become aware of what is actually happening and the short time-line we are under to try to avert disaster. (available to watch FREE online)

Per ardua ad astra (Through adversity to the stars) RCAF Motto

story:
Hi everyone , welcome to Swing Blade skateboards!!!

I don't have any fancy videos or professional marketing to show you but I do have my amazing invention called Swing Blade skateboard.

I have been developing my skateboards for about 6 years now and finally have an awesome design kids are going to love!

No foot push off needed!

I discovered Swing Blade even climbs up hills and inclines!

No electric motors or batteries are needed just the movements of your body operates my skateboards without the use of foot push off!

We have purchased the building and parts to manufacturer our new skateboards.
We will need help funding marketing and web design to complete the final phases of mass production.

Anything you can do to help get my product out to the World would be greatly appreciated!

Thanks,

Dennis Wells

story:
The Audio Control Alert System (ACS) is an emergency siren detector for automobile use that is designed to control the media audio and alert occupants of approaching emergency vehicles for safety measures upon detection.  Focusing on providing greater situational awareness when it matters most,  the ACS alerts the driver to take prompt actions (yield, slow down, pull over, etc.) which are crucial to collision prevention.  Implementation is based on utilizing a modern microprocessor to perform audio processing to filter specific sequence of tones and frequencies of surrounding sound.  A perfect solution to be implemented onto the onboard computer of new generational automobiles equipped with ANC or as a standalone embedded system.

Accidents involving emergency vehicles such as fire trucks, ambulances, and police cars are a substantial problem in the United States.  Vehicle fatality rates for emergency responders are estimated to be up to 4.8 times higher than the national average. Most emergency vehicle accidents occur at intersection. Because emergency vehicles are typically traveling at higher speeds in urgent situations, the accidents often result in severe injury or death to occupants of the emergency vehicle or the passenger vehicle involved.

Below are some statistics regarding emergency vehicle accidents illustrating how large the problem is in the U.S.

Ambulance Accidents in the U.S.

The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) released a report in April of 2014 that provides an overview of the number of ambulance accidents in the United States. The agency studied the number of ambulance accidents over a 20 year period from 1992-2011.

Below are some of the key findings from the report:

  • Over the 20 year period, there were an estimated 4,500 accidents involving ambulances each year.
  • 35% of accidents resulted in injury or fatality to at least 1 occupant of a vehicle involved.
  • An average of 29 fatal ambulance accidents produced 33 fatalities each year.
  • On average, 2,600 people are injured in 1,500 ambulance accidents each year.
  • Of those killed in an ambulance accident, 63% were occupants of a passenger vehicle, 21% were passengers in the ambulance, and 4% were the ambulance driver.

Firetruck Accidents in the U.S.

According to data from the NHTSA and the United States Fire Administration (USFA), firetruck accidents are the second leading cause of on-the-job deaths for firefighters.

Below are some key findings from an analysis of NHTSA data on firetruck accidents from 2000-2009:

  • Over that 10 year period, there were roughly 31,600 accidents involving fire vehicles.
  • Rollovers account for 66% of all fatal firetruck accidents.

Police Car Accidents in the U.S.

Using data from 1994-2002, researchers from the University of Washington performed an analysis of the number of fatalities each year that occur during police pursuits.

Below are some of their key findings:

  • Each year there are approximately 300 fatalities in the U.S. that occur during police pursuits.
  • Just over 30% of the fatalities occurred to people who were not involved in the pursuit.

Emergency responders perform an honorable and important job, but they still have a duty to respond to emergencies as safely as possible. Accidents involving emergency vehicles occur far too often in our country and many, if not most, of them are avoidable.  Imagine if you or a love one got injured or killed in an accident with an ambulance, firetruck, police car, or other emergency vehicle that could have been prevented if such device was implemented to alert you ahead of time.

TBA

Prolific Circuits, specializes in embedded system designs and development. Our current project ACS, primary goal is to design an appropriate embedded solution for detecting approaching sirens to ensure driver safety and keeping the streets safer than ever for emergency vehicles when it matters most. Our engineers are experienced in all aspects of embedded system design. Our process of problem solving solution includes research, design, prototype, testing, through board design, to shipment of final product. Maintaining a well-linked team environment within our office allows us to prioritize several key elements we believe are representative of our quality as a business which include exceptional customer service and support as well as the establishment of easy-to-work-with professional partnerships.

   http://prolificcircuits.com

 

  

 

 

The development of the ACS highlights the challenge of dealing with loud environment that generates a lot of noise which obscures the siren when analyzing signals.  The noise can sometimes lead to false positives which make the siren detection partially reliable.  It's relatively easy to get a signal and break it down into its component frequencies with the Fourier transform.  However with weak signals or noisy environments, enhancements are necessary to interpret meaning of the output more accurately.

Reliable emergency siren detection will likely evolve in analyzing the audio and in removing sources of noise. Your support will help us further develop our product on many levels.  Some ideas in considerations are:

  • Improve digital audio filtering to remove and enhance audio frequencies.
  • Enhance features such as voice prompt and alert display thru media system signalling the direction of siren and notifying driver to yield.
  • Run filters to remove higher frequency noise from the audio.
  • Upgrade microphone, RTOS, increase FFT Size for better resolution.
  • Apply other technique/method such as Doppler Effect for approaching / departing vehicles, etc.

Emergency responders perform an honorable and important job, but they still have a duty to respond to emergencies as safely as possible. Accidents involving emergency vehicles occur far too often in our country and many, if not most, of them are avoidable.  Imagine if you or a love one got injured or killed in an accident with an ambulance, firetruck, police car, or other emergency vehicle that could have been prevented if such device was implemented to alert you ahead of time.TBAProlific Circuits, specializes in embedded system designs and development. Our current project ACS, primary goal is to design an appropriate embedded solution for detecting approaching sirens to ensure driver safety and keeping the streets safer than ever for emergency vehicles when it matters most. Our engineers are experienced in all aspects of embedded system design. Our process of problem solving solution includes research, design, prototype, testing, through board design, to shipment of final product. Maintaining a well-linked team environment within our office allows us to prioritize several key elements we believe are representative of our quality as a business which include exceptional customer service and support as well as the establishment of easy-to-work-with professional partnerships.   http://prolificcircuits.com     The development of the ACS highlights the challenge of dealing with loud environment that generates a lot of noise which obscures the siren when analyzing signals.  The noise can sometimes lead to false positives which make the siren detection partially reliable.  It's relatively easy to get a signal and break it down into its component frequencies with the Fourier transform.  However with weak signals or noisy environments, enhancements are necessary to interpret meaning of the output more accurately.Reliable emergency siren detection will likely evolve in analyzing the audio and in removing sources of noise. Your support will help us further develop our product on many levels.  Some ideas in considerations are:
Improve digital audio filtering to remove and enhance audio frequencies.
Enhance features such as voice prompt and alert display thru media system signalling the direction of siren and notifying driver to yield.
Run filters to remove higher frequency noise from the audio.
Upgrade microphone, RTOS, increase FFT Size for better resolution.
Apply other technique/method such as Doppler Effect for approaching / departing vehicles, etc.

story:
Personal Green Energy

Our vision is to " Generate " your own clean energy with the cycling speed.

Or, store it in your power bank.

When you charge with The Pedaling-Powered USB Charger instead of from the wall, you are offsetting the carbon footprint of your devices using Green Energy that you generated.

Cycling for your health. The Pedaling-Powered USB Charger for our Earth.

 

 

 

Many check-ins and phone calls. No problem .

Get Pedaling and charge your iPhone.

 

What is The Pedaling-Powered USB Charger ?

 

The Pedaling-Powered USB Charger is your bicycle electricity generator.

It is a front wheel dynamo hub, which is built-in the Smart Control Board

with Patent Pending.

This uses the spinning motion of the front wheel to generate electricity.

 

With the attached Dual Port USB socket, you could charge all your electronic gadgets in the cockpit.  

As our demo video showed that the output is 1.71A x 5.25V =8.9W

You are able to charge all of them just in time.

 

To generate with normal dynamo hub, you have to risk maintaining at high speed or wait for the long downhill road.

However, unlike most other purely mechanical dynamo hubs, the Pedaling-Powered USB Charger can generate from 5km/h owing to the design of Programmable Control Board.

It is just like the speed you pull your bike.

Overvoltage ? Don't worry.

The electric output would be limited and fixed while speed up to 20km/h.

Please refer to the charging output graph.

Comparison Chart with Others

 

Tech Specs

  USB Charger ( Dynamo Hub )

 Torque 350kgf.cm (battery fully charged)         Water Rating: IPX6 

 Dual Port USB Socket Dimension:60x40x6 mm.  Cable Length: 1 meter.

( Note: Socket dimension may be subject to change.)

 

 

26" Front Wheel
 
 
 

 

The Pedaling-Powered USB Charger Development and the Team

We are a group of enthusiasts with a technical background. Our speciality is the design and production of bicycle related gadgets. The next generation of the USB Charger ( Smart Dynamo Hub) has already been in the pipeline. LED Light is planned to be built-in in the hub. Moreover, GPS module and other sensors as well would be considered in the future models. 

 

Our Timeline

Our Timeline has been thoroughly planned and reviewed by the firms we are working with. All we need is your support.

May,2015: The idea was born.

Sep,2016:  Producing the proof-of-concept prototype.

Jan,2017 :  Tests and final design.

Jun,2017 :  Finalized and order production toolings.

Jul, 2017 :  Launching Indiegogo campaign.

                       Preparing pre-production.

Sep,2017 : Manufacturing the first production run.

Nov,2017 : Assembling the first production run.

Dec,2017 : Delivering the early bird batch.

                

 

Risks and Challenges 

The Pedaling-Powered USB Charger has come a long way from the initial idea two years ago. We have developed and tested numerous prototypes, learnt many lessons and collaborated with some of the top designers and engineers in the country to bring the production-ready designs you see now.

We have partnered with some of the top names in the bicycles world - take The Pedaling-Powered USB Charger to the next level. Our designs have been refined by an experienced Design for Manufacture agency, Liming. With their help, we have engaged reliable manufacturers to ensure we can be down on the ground watching the USB Charger emerge!

As with many new product launches, there may be unforeseen factors that result in a delay. Through extensive testing and reiteration we have ruled out many unexpected events and we have been very conservative on our timeline. It may be the case that we can deliver The Pedaling-Powered USB Charger even sooner, but there may also be a possibility of some delay.

We will do our utter best to deliver the highest quality product to you as soon as possible and communicate effectively and regularly about our progress along the way.

 

 

Please support us and help share.

story:
Troja Bike can NOT be removed, switched off or destroyed by the thief. The battery works up to 1 season and can be recharged.


Troja Bike is the first and only GPS positioning system that can be neither turned off nor removed or destroyed by thieves. Troja bike is securely fixed inside the bicycle frame and can be easily operated. The battery runs up to a season and can be recharged at any time. The cellular connection is available in 44 countries and Troja Bike uses all available satellite systems for position determination:

>>Hier geht's zum DEUTSCHEN Text/Click here for the GERMAN version<<

Service Center

We will take care of you if your bike gets stolen. Our service center serves every customer in case of theft, working closely with local police and law enforcement, and, upon request, passing on the live GPS data to the authorities to allow rapid and smooth processing. We offer the police a direct interface to the reported stolen bicycles. 

Motion Sensor

If you park your bike, just switch on the motion sensor; you will receive a message if someone unauthorized is moving your bicycle.

Individual position polling

You can request the location of your bike at any time, regardless of whether it was stolen or not.

Anonymity

Troja Bike is completely anonymous. An email address is enough to register with the network and to use Troja Bike. It is also possible to enter the serial number of the bicycle, upload a photo of your bike, and enter your insurance information.

Cooperation with Insurance and Police

Many insurance companies are interested in integrating Troja Bike into their insurance models. More information will follow soon. Only in case of theft the police get the position of your bicycle.

Troja Bike sport

Troja Bike Sport offers the possibility of connecting to our Sports App with evaluations of traveled routes and comparing and sharing the data with friends. Troja Bike sport is an upgrade and can be installed and run online at any time. The transfer of the routes driven is transmitted by Bluetooth to the Troja Bike App.

Two simple steps will get your Troja Bike ready 

1) First, connect Troja Bike to the app. 

After downloading the Troja Bike App, the accompanying QR-Code will link the app to your Troja Bike. 

2) Second, simply mount Troja Bike into your bicycle frame. 

It's very simple: remove the seat, insert Troja Bike into the frame and mount the seat again. Use the app to lock and unlock Troja Bike.

A bicycle is usually a long-term, often expensive purchase. It accompanies you in everyday life as well as during some of your leisure activities. A stolen bike is more than just a nuisance; it negatively impacts your daily life and is a financial burden, 

and that's where Troja Bike can help: 

Our GPS tracker is mounted inside the bicycle frame, invisible to the thief. Troja Bike cannot be turned off, manipulated, or removed by the thief. Once the bike has been stolen, it can be easily tracked and located via the mobile app. The Troja Bike App displays the exact location of your or your child's bike at any given time.

 We are pleased to announce that Troja Bike will also be available in Taiwan, Singapore, Brazil, Argentina and South Africa. The annual mobile service charge for these countries has yet to be negotiated. We’ll keep you updated! Thanks for your support! 

Who are the masterminds behind Troja Bike? 

In 2012, brothers Marek and Adrian Rauko began to explore their idea of ​​developing their own GPS tracking system. 

Adrian was active as a private investigator for many years. Let down by unreliable locating devices, he decided to take matters into his own hands and to finally develop a device that met his specific needs. 

Marek, a trained electrical engineer and IT manager, embraced the idea and joined his brother in the development of the new device. As a result, Troja currently is the best GPS system for authorities and detectives on the market.  

This sophisticated technology is now used for the development of Troja bike. Adrian and Marek are joined by their hard-working staff - a big thank you to the entire team!

Troja for police, which is the technical basis for Troja Bike, has already been tested in many countries and has recorded more than 500,000 kilometers driven. The required FCC ID in order to offer our product in the US and Canada has already been issued (FCC ID).

 Functionalities of Troja Bike 

  • Troja Bike cannot be removed, destroyed or disabled by the thief 
  • The battery can last up to a season and can then easily be recharged by induction 
  • The position data is transmitted via cellular networks 
  • Troja Bike uses GPS, Glonass, Galileo and Baidu 
  • Our service center is always there for you in case your bike has been stolen 
  • We offer the authorities in charge a direct interface to the stolen bicycles 
  • Many insurance companies offer discounts when using Troja Bike (the negotiations are ongoing, more on that soon) 
  • A motion sensor protects your bike 
  • Troja Bike can easily be installed and operated via the app 
  • Individual GPS locations can be requested. 
  • Troja Bike sport can be connected to upgrade the Troja Bike App to a Sports App

Why crowdfunding?

As you can see, our project is already well advanced - yet we are a young company that has a vision and relies on the power of the crowd. We are sure that Troja Bike will play a vital role in reducing the number of bikes stolen as well as in resolving many of these stolen bike cases. 

To build Troja Bike, we adapt, to a large extent, the electronics from our existing GPS tracker Troja. In addition, we need to modify the casing and bring the locking mechanism to perfection. The very simple and easy-to-use user interface for Troja Bike is inspired by the UI of Troja. To implement all of this as quickly as possible, we need your support.

Our Partners

  • KTM Bike Industries

  • T-Mobile

  • Loewe Technologies

  • KBFilm

Since we already have a very sophisticated technology with our existing GPS tracker Troja, the risks with Troja Bike are easy to manage. The electronics are largely taken from Troja and they only need to be adjusted in size. The other thing that still needs to be developed by us, is the casing and we are working closely together with a German partner company specializing in that field. Then the only thing left to do, is to finalize the locking mechanism. The very simple and easy-to-use user interface for Troja Bike is inspired by the UI of Troja.
